description:
Although not super inviting from the outside, we loved this place. Our server was kind and the fresh rose on each table was cute. We loved everything we ordered and will definitely come again. We tried the medium and medium to spicy, and I think we would prefer all our dishes medium to spicy next time. Naan was soft and crunchy, perfect.

Prawn vindaloo 5/5
Chicken korma 5/5
Saag Paneer 5/5
Garlic Naan 5/5
author: Nicole J.

description:
I ordered for delivery the chicken 65 and matter paneer. 

The food was hot and cooked perfectly, but ZERO spice. It was as mild as baby or hospital food. If I wanted bland food, I would certainly not have ordered South Indian. And I never will again from them. 

Spice it up for your next customers!
author: Sarah S.

description:
VEGETARIAN REVIEW

Wow, this took me back to when I had the best naan of my life in Kerela a couple years ago. This place has Goanese style food with the thin style naan that blows North Indian naan out of the water in my opinion.

I also ordered the bangan bartha and paneer tikka masala. 

B.B. was different, lots of peas and nice and light! The paneer tikka masala was yummy. 

Solid experience, I'd come back to try more food!


Ps. I tried the pesto paneer tikka once before too and I loved it!!
author: Shruti D.

description:
Had some excitement happen during our visit...

My boyfriend and I made it to the restaurant a few minutes to 3pm, and the waiter welcomed us in and told us to get plates and help ourselves at the buffet. He advised they close from 3-5 to get ready for dinner service. No problem, we were happy they served us so close to 3.   They brought fresh, hot naan and drinks.  Although they were technically "closed" at that point, We never felt rushed and the food was delicious. Here's where it gets weird...

This guy comes in (at least 3:15at this point), the waiter politely tells the customer that they are closed between three and five. The customer sits down at the table and demands to be served. He shouts something like "All these other people are eating!"  He is advised the few people left were here before 3pm and now the buffet is closed.  The guy is totally loud and belligerent demanding water and to be served. He takes out his phone and starts recording the whole event as if they were discriminating against him for some reason. He was ridiculous.  

Dude. You missed lunch, accept it an move on. Sheesh. 

Anyway, back in the land of sanity, the waiter and manager remained calm and professional. Eventually the guy left.  All the patrons left in the restaurant agreed that guy was totally out of line, and the staff handled it well. 

Great lunch buffet, clean restaurant and friendly staff. Will go back for dinner! 

...
author: Christine S.

description: This place is near where I am staying. I have been twice over the last couple of months. Really good food and they are very nice. Prices are good, too. I knocked off a star because it's not inviting from the outside. The decor inside is sparse. It doesn't have a lot of charm. They do a buffet for lunch. I'm sure I'll go back.
author: Tom T.

description: I don't recall the last time i had Goan food, maybe when I was in Goa eons ago. Had the chicken tikka masala, fish curry and naan. Decent food.
author: Sunil R.

description: I could smell the deliciousness blocks away! I did a quick Yelp search and found this great Indian Buffet lunch! At a great price!
author: courtney m.

description: Great affordable lunch buffet for a quick work outing. Attentive service and many options.
author: Tanya W.

description: Viva Goa is our go to Indian spot! We order delivery or pickup regularly, and especially love the fact that they offer brown rice! We especially like the Karachi chicken, and everything is always the right amount of spicy (we ask for medium spice). We will continue to order from this gem.
author: Bailey D.

description:
I have had Goan food in India lots of times. However, this was my first time having Goan food in a restaurant in the US.
This is a hidden gem. Restaurant was in a great location, and spacious.
The pomfret dish was excellent, great balance of spices and flavor! Fish tasted very fresh.
It is possible to order sorpital, off the menu. It is a well-known Goan dish made of pork. 
The roti was very good as well.
author: Ashley A.

description: Worst service ever. The server was rude when we ordered the buffet. We were made to wait for so long for naans and I'd not recommend anyone just due to bad service.
author: Alok U.

description:
Bottom line: Fine spot for Indian food.

Context: Visited a number of times for lunch buffet, for dinner, and for takeout.

Service: Friendly

Favorite: Samosas for takeout
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
Good food, slow service!
We tried the chicken lollipops(appetiser). Chicken was tender and the gravy was good as well. 
Chicken Vindaloo and Garlic Naan were on point too! We like spicy food so when we asked for it they were happy to customise the recipe accordingly. 

Dont order Gulabjamun for dessert.
author: Saket K.

description:
In my travels and sojourn through Asia, I have become rather familiar with the varying cuisines. In India, for instance, there was a distinct difference between Indian cuisine and Goan cuisine. The latter cuisine, it appears, took the Indian cuisine a step further by adding unique hand ground spices, coconut vinegar and coconut milk (thanks to the Portuguese influence) resulting in an altogether original cuisine.

Viva Goa restaurant, having opted for that name, ought to have focussed wholly on providing traditional Goan dishes instead of conflicting the menu with Indian dishes. There are plentiful Indian restaurants which are more qualified in serving savory Indian specialty dishes to their customers. 

Another comment: Don't ever expect to savor the same mouth watering dish created in the country of origin and replicated elsewhere. It doesn't work that way. Therefore, expect the expected disappointment. If you crave for true Goan dishes, book a flight to Goa.

Additionally, we live in an age where demand exceeds natural production. If some reviewers are bitter about the curries served here that appear to have no coconut milk incorprated, guess what? Who in this day and age has the time to grate a coconut and extract the milk to favor you with a curry made with authentic coconut milk? As for the ready made coconut milk which comes in cans, do the math. Most of the canned coconut milk comes from Thailand, and these too by the millions. How many coconut trees are there in Thailand to feed the world's demand for coconut milk? The result? You guessed it: synthetic coconut milk which make most curries at restaurants taste like they were not made with coconut milk.
author: D M.

description:
the restaurant do not make authetic Goan food. If you order Chicken goan style, there is no coconut in it. It is basically a North Indian style.
Non-Indians don't know what is authetic Goan food. 
We ordered fish Vindaloo and it turned out to be full of kind of tomato ketchup. It is supposed to be full of indian spices. 
We can't be fooled.
author: Pia D.

description: This is a go to restaurant for us. We have liked all the food though recently found a daal dish a little lacking in texture as it was too liquid. We will go back though. They seem to mostly serve delivery food.
author: Ashley S.

description: Best Indian food I've had, bar none.  I'm usually a heavy spice and lamb or chicken guy but tonight we got fish curry and an eggplant dish that were INCREDIBLE!  and don't miss the vegetable samosas...  Vegetarians may be on to something.  Well Done!!
author: Robert B.

description:
My journey to find the best Chicken Tikka Marsala (CTM) in SF continues. This place gets close but doesn't quite hit the mark. The CTM sauce was superb--lighter color, good taste and texture, and creaminess--not too sweet, not too spicy. Just right. The chicken itself however wasn't tender enough and didn't hit the spot the way I had hoped.  Also, they could work on improving their rice and naan. The former wasn't a good batch (not fluffy enough) and the bread didn't taste fresh out of the oven and was too thin. 

Still, this is a solid option to satisfy that CTM craving. The sauce alone is a winner for me.
author: Behnam S.

description:
3.5 STARS

The roommate wasn't sure what he wanted for lunch and I had some drinks the night before. Since he let me choose, I picked my favorite comfort food after a night of drinking: Indian! We got delivery for lunch last Sunday, June 5th through DoorDash. We placed the order at 11:44am and it arrived at 12:36pm. I live in Outer Richmond.

*Vegetable Samosas: Potatoes and green peas with mixed Indian spices and wrapped in a golden crispy pastry ($5)
*Butter Chicken: Tandoori chicken cooked with a blended mild tomato base cream sauce, Very Spicy ($11.99)
*Chicken Tikka Masala: Oven roasted chicken breast cooked with tomato and onion base cream sauce, Very Spicy ($11.99)
*Onion Naan: Naan stuffed with onion and herbs ($3.49)
*Garlic Naan: Naan topped with chopped garlic ($3.49) x2

I adored the curries. They were both rich and creamy with a good amount of spice. I liked the tikka masala more than the butter chicken, but that's more of a flavor preference on my part. I liked the creaminess and heat of it more. The garlic naan was a great tool to sop up the curry. Soft, chewy and with great garlic flavor. The roomie always orders onion naan and seemed to enjoy this. I'd recommend staying away from the samosas. They were overly hard and salty. They resisted and crumbled when I tried to break them in half. Not good at all.

Overall, good chicken tikka masala and garlic naan. Just stay away from the samosas. So bad!
author: Elena N.

description: Authentic Goan food. Love love love it!!! This brings back childhood memories for me. If you like spicy food and coconut, this place is for you. The staff is also wonderful. A++
author: Foram D.

description:
Wow, what a restaurant! From the waiters to the meal, everything was exceptional. My boyfriend and I searched Yelp craving Indian food and we found Viva Goa. We came here and for a week day we were a bit surprised to be the only ones here at 8 p.m. Eventually, a few more late night diners came in.

Our waiter was extremely friendly and helpful going through the menu. We ordered chicken tikka masala and butter chicken. All I can say is the butter chicken knocked me on the floor. YOU MUST GET when you come here. 

Nicholas out did himself and I have zero complaints whatsoever. 100% coming back. Thank you Viva Goa!!
author: Ariana S.

description:
Brought an Indian friend here. Intimate but pretty popular. We got a table quickly but the place filled up not long after and got pretty noisy. 
We ordered from the vegetarian menu and enjoyed EVERYTHING we got. (Vegetable Caldin, Navrattan Korma, rice, garlic naan, Kingfisher beer, and mango and pistachio kulfi.)
The only downside was that they only had two waiters--when the place got packed we had to wait longer than usual for our orders.
Looking forward to my next visit so I can try more of their veg and dessert offerings! Hopefully they'll have more wait staff!
author: Eduardo E.

description:
Very disappointing to see the terrible food safety score as this used to be my absolute favorite Indian restaurant ever.

Hopefully management will take the inspection seriously and post exactly what improvements and changes they've made to address being "in the bottom 5% of local food scores"

Heartbreaking news, but I wouldn't recommend anybody eat anywhere with the lowest food safety scores in the entire city. There's just no excuse for that.
author: Marky M.

description:
So this place looks like a lil divey Indian restaurant from the outside but a fancy cloth napkin dim light romantic spot  on the inside. My mom and I found it on a whim and we were so delighted. She has never had Indian so we literally picked random food to try. 
Roti (wheat nan), chicken tandoori, and lamb Karman and curry mussels! Every bite was absolutely amazing! The service was stellar as well! 
Great hidden gem of SF!
author: Tracy W.

description:
Note: This is a Goan restaurant (i.e. serves Portuguese-Indian food). So if you order dishes PLEASE do not order tandooris, tikka masalas, karachi chicken, naan, etc. (These are NOT Goan dishes and do not represent the ethnicity of this restaurant).

I LOVED the Goan dishes. The only drawback being the selection (and freshness) of fish... one simply does not have the same options as in Goa.

The staff is very friendly and nice.

Only reason for giving it 3 stars is the DREADFUL food safety rating (60 at the time of writing, probably the dirtiest restaurant in the city). How can you guys be so disgusting???

Please fix your hygiene and food handling. Until then, I am staying away.
author: T S.

description:
Came here for dinner on a Friday night and there were plenty of tables available. 

All of the food was really good. I had the vegetable samosas, chicken saag, and lamb xacruti. Everything was cooked well and extremely flavorful. Make sure to get some naan! The pesto naan was great. 

For drinks, I would recommend the mango lassi. Service here is above average. Viva Goa is a bit on the pricey side but it's well worth it for authentic Indian food. 

Food: 5/5
Value: 3.75/5
Service: 4/5
Overall: 4.5/5
author: Brian G.

description:
I'm so said to say dat it's a Goan restaurant 
I'm a Goan 
I'm from Vegas N i n my 2 friends had come to meet a frd who was working on a cruise ship we had lunch in des restaurant n went to d zoo 
We came bk at 5:15pm n ordered food to go but v dint get what v ordered
author: Edrich Jasson P.

description:
Viva goa.. The name reflected as if it would have a sea food speciality... Huge Disappointment... 
The only thing that saved the cause " Lombard street"
Rating 1.5*
author: Ameya P.

description:
The best Indian food we've found in SF. Excellent cuisine and thoughtful staff. The food is authentic and memorably tasty. 

Top dishes we've found:
 - Ambit tik (fish; spicy)
 - Tikka masala (chicken)
 - Curry Xacuti (prawn)
 - Korma (lamb)
 
Add in some garlic naan and Kingfishers and you're in heaven. Having traveled to India, this food is the real deal. You can ignore the antiquated "warnings" - we asked to meet the chef and they took us back in the kitchen and it was cleaner than my kitchen. 

The gf and I probably go there once/week. Ambiance is modest / dimly lit. Highly recommend.
author: Luke D.

description: The food tastes good but my wife and I had a really bad food poisoning... Stay away from this place.
author: Julien R.

description: This restaurant was clean and well organized. The food was great and filled with plenty of flavors.
author: Tommy Gun Z.

description:
Hubby was craving Goan/ Mangalorian cuisine. This place has authentic food. To top it all they do have gluten dairy and soy free options. To read more visit my page.

https://www.facebook.com/CookHealNourish/posts/330901890668985
author: Reshma M.

description:
One of our favorite Indian restaurants in NorCal and probably the most unique. Fish masala fry is best Indian fish dish ever.  We've ordered it a dozen times and always super.

Calamari is also very unique.  Chicken xacuti is very good. Mango chutney is the magic touch.  Servers also are excellent
author: Jonathan G.

description: The restaurant will greet you with a cozy decor. Authentic and great style, small quaint, awesome satisfactory and worth every dollars.
author: Audrey C.

description: One of the best around. Owners/employees nice. Food good and a tad different bc of the Goan roots. Decor dive like but endearing. Total winner. We eat here almost 1x/week.
author: T B.

description: Great food for the rate. Restaurant could use a little more ambiance, but it's a hot for the food!
author: Faye M.

description:
If there's one country that has the Goan spices, it's India, and that's when Viva Goa has finally made it here in SF with the rest of the other Indian restaurants.  This restaurant is the reason I go there, to try the authentic Goan spices!  I'm glad walk-ins are acceptable, so I can find a table just for me.  I got a free glass of water and I first ordered the Indian Tea (Chai with milk).  One sip of Chai in a ceramic cup, bold but not spicy, and it's good for me without adding sugar.

The atmosphere isn't bad at all with those dim lights everywhere.  The smell of various kinds of spices didn't just come from their plates, the lunch buffet area is where all the spices come from.  But I came here to try the best dish in the restaurant.  Thus, I savor the lunch buffet on my next future visit.  I was getting my waiter's attention so I ordered the following: Vegetable Caldin, Aloo Paratha, and Raita.  Oh, and I chose the Basmati Rice.  It's nice to talk to other patrons sitting in their respective tables, even while waiting for the food.  I asked one of the three men from my right side, saying "how's your food?".  Then he said "it taste good".  Many people enjoy their food straight from the lunch buffet while talking.  Me, I enjoyed observing most of the people here.  After waiting for twenty minutes, my food has arrived, and almost filled my whole table.  One of the three men I talked to said I'm a "happy camper".  Great!  Time for my feast.

A bread basket of Aloo Paratha looked fried to the deep crisp.  The first piece of naan bread tasted crispy on the outside with rich chunky potatoes on the inside.  Tasted so good with and without the Goan spices, I couldn't stop wolfing all the pieces, until I came to the point of slowing down.

Then I got to the Vegetable Caldin.  I wasn't fooled by its small size.  I knew there's more vegetables on the bottom with green herbs on the top.  And the yellow part that dominate the entire bowl, could be squash or turmeric with hints of coconut water.  With cumin, coriander, and the Goan spices, made a very warm bowl altogether.

I know I couldn't easily finished the Basmati Rice.  I only finished some of its lengthy whites and all the green peas.  Raita was the last one I finished.  Taste like yogurt dip with strips of carrots and cucumbers.  Just a few spoonful sips, and it eased my digestion.

I managed to finish most of the meal.  No homemade ice cream for me.  I was all good.  The food was good too.  And so are the very friendly waiters.
author: Jimmy C.

description: Best place we have found in San Francisco that tastes like homemade Indian food! Great vegetarian options like the Caldin, Saag Paneer, Chana Xacuti etc. I order in from Viva Goa when I'm craving good tasty Indian food and especially when I'm sick and unable cook at home, eating from here makes me feel so good plus it's nutritious and healthy (very little oil compared to standard Indian restaurants)! Do give it a try!
author: Divya K.

description: Great Indian food. My favorites are the butter chicken, mattar paneer, veg biryani and garlic naan.
author: Marwan M.

description: The ambience was good. Service was great too! It was disappointing to not see Sol Kadhi served at a place which has "Goa" in its name. The food was decent, not extra ordinary.
author: Tejashree M.

description: It has a very good ambience food is up to the mark very good friendly service and I just look forward to go back again viva Goa.
author: Dominic F.

description: A real gem. The food is delicious and a little different that typical Indian restaurant - which is refreshing and so delicious.
author: Christina C.

description:
Very nice place. Clean, good kitchen
 Friendly staff. Made as buffet, but has meet, rice, salads, fruits, and also some sweets. Relaximg music. 

If will travel to San Francisco definetly will stop by again
author: Anya S.

description:
Very small but nice place. Me and my friend went for a lunch buffet. They didn't have much varieties but let me tell you this - every single item they had was delicious. The flavors were good and food felt fresh.

There tandoori chicken is a must try and also goan chicken curry. There vegetables dishes were also very tasty. 

Not an expensive place either.
author: Avi R.

description: Best Indian food I ever had in San Francisco. Love this place, gives you real Goa feel. Malai kofta and biryani is best
author: Abhishek P.

description:
If you need a vindaloo, go to a place with Goa in the name (that's where this dish comes from).  

Ordered to chicken vindaloo and told them to make it spicy. Food showed up pronto and was delicious. Didn't think it was spicy enough at start, but the heat grows (like it's supposed to). Overall and very good curry and highly recommended for takeout. The dining room experience is a throw back to the 1970's, but the grub is pukka.
author: Sean S.

description: Great lunch spot! Me being from India, I am always hesitant on going to Indian restaurants because I get better tasting food at home. But this is a awesome little restaurant- and especially for lunch. i work near by and will definitely be going again! Not over the top spicy or creamy food (usually they do that in buffets to fill quantity).
author: Ankit S.

description: I love Indian food and this is a top spot. The best Indian restaurant in SF.  Authentic food, lovely location and quick local delivery. Friendly and very attentive team. I highly recommend North India Restaurant!
author: Tsegi S.

description:
First time tasted the authentic Goan curry I am originally from India for all you folks who want to have a scrumptious meal buffet for $12 weekdays is a steal deal.
 Come with ur loved ones enjoy the meal ur gonna cheers and come back for more and wonder I wish I could eat more but my stomach is full 
  Pls call and check the menu of the day and the buffet
author: Sabah K.

description: i lahhvvvv this place. the service is great the vibe is romantic i mean it's not super fancy but what i adore about this place is i've liked  everything i've ever ordered thus far. i've been here 7+ times and this place does not disappoint !! reasonably priced too for marina !! their soup is bomb like seriously who says that about an indian restaurant even their SOUP is good on top of their curries being amazing. and fyi if you say spicy it's spicy yo. a boy might argue with me and say ehh their spicy ain't spicy it's like mild spicy but to my girlie ass its spicy. have water in hand. street parking is easy except on weekends when it's sunny as eff pls lord baby jesus do not drive
author: Reese A.

description: Ordered takeout from Via Goa last night and was delivered a cockroach with the meal... the entire full body roach complete with legs and antennas came inside my rice. We have been here a bunch in the past but this is not acceptable at all. I would be careful going or ordering from here for if they have roaches in the delivery they have roaches in the in house meals too. This was the nastiest thing I ever saw.
author: Russell R.

description:
As far as Indian buffets go, Viva Goa is right up there for variety with a couple of unique dishes that are distinctly Goan. Plus at $8.99 on weekdays, it's an absolute lunchtime steal.  

Seafood is an integral part of Goan cuisine and at this buffet, you get some Goan fish curry to soak up that fluffy basmati rice. The curry is pretty light but I appreciate that it's a dish not typically found in other Indian buffets. Vegetarians will also appreciate that this buffet has a wide spread of vegetarian dishes ranging from a mixed vegetable vindaloo to samosas to sag paneer and lots more. I especially love the Goan salad. It's bright with a nice mix of pickled veggies and chickpeas - very refreshing counterpoint to the various curries. As with all other Indian buffets, expect the usual chicken tandoori and chicken tikka masala. All in all, a hearty and fulfilling meal with mild spices for those dreary SF afternoons. 

It's a little dark inside and the décor is a little  dated but service is attentive especially when it comes to keeping your water glass full. Indian food isn't what comes first to mind when you mention the Marina but Viva Goa is pretty legit and probably one of the best lunchtime values in the neighborhood.
author: Jon L.

description: My husband and I went to dinner with our friends, who are Indian food aficionados.  As expected, it was an absolutely delicious meal.  We ate a wide variety of meat and vegetable dishes and every single one was exquisite.  I have passed by their sign on Lombard whenever I've been in the city, but wasn't sure what kind of cuisine it was.  Now that I have been, we will be returning often!  Highly recommend for a delicious meal!
author: Lizzie B.

description: Love this place! Usually order take out a few times a week. I love Indian food, but can't handle the spice, and they are sooooo good about making it mild for me.
author: Caitlin M.

description:
No 1. Restorent  very clean service 1 
Niclos joe  the best the very nice  person  thy are from Viva GOA fell like home Monday lunch Buffet only$10.99. ASh from SF
author: A S.

description: Super good! I order the tiki masala and the butter chicken for dinner , both excellent ! Recommend ;)
author: Celeste B.

description: Most underwhelming Indian food I ever ate. The naan was soggy. And butter chicken was pretty tasteless.
author: Kate R.

description: Great Indian Food, very consistent delicious recipes and fast delivery service. My favorite dishes are chicken breast marinated in yogurt and baked in clay oven and also I tried the fish last night and it was amazing. Highly recommend it!
author: Julia K.

description: Always come here when i visit golden gate bridge!  I consider myself a regular visitor because of that. I prefer their menu food over the buffet since they dont have many Goan dishes in buffet.
author: Abey M.

description: Extremely slow service. Waiters will not deign to replenish your water. Food is definitely not authentic Goan cuisine. Everything we ordered came drenched in cheap, sour tomato paste.
author: Athena A.

description: We used to live in the neighborhood and this was a staple for us. When we arrived, we never had a problem securing a seat and also the delivery is very quick indeed. The items we recommend would be the butter chicken, by far the best we have ever had. Additionally, I would suggest you order the samosas. They are huge and could be a meal on their own, perfectly seasoned and go really well with the tamarind sauce. Also, on the appetizer side, check out the garlic naan, fresh fired and soft while also nicely charred for flavor.
author: Andy A.

description:
What they do deliver is delicious . Especially the lamb dishes and vegetable pakora .
Excellent .
author: Denise D.

description: Ordered bunch of samosas from here yesterday, they were bad. Fried in reused oil and salty.
author: Zoheb M.

description: Incredible food and service. You honestly can't go wrong on the menu. My favorite is the Navrattan Korma. Reasonably priced and really high quality - it's honestly a hidden gem.
author: Alex J.

description: Absolutely LOVE this place! This spot is now my go to spot for Indian food. The place is very nice, the food is delicious! I tried literally EVERYTHING at the lunch special buffet and I loved it all! I would definitely recommend stopping by from 12-3pm Monday-Friday which is their buffet special. Try the mango lassi (mango yogurt drink). The service is also exceptional. You wont regret coming here!
author: J P.

description:
Mediocre Indian food, have been to better Indian restaurants in SF like Gajalee (unfortunately closed now) and DOSA.
Although the ambience was good, but the food was just not good enough, service not upto the mark, not worth the money spent.
author: Rashmi A.

description:
We wanted to try something different so we chose this place. There was a lunch buffet. They didn't have a lot of options. There was nothing Goan. That wasn't an issue for us though. 
We were not happy with the food. Non Veg curries were average at best. Fish curry was not good(tasted like tomato soup).

Veg item were fine though. I will give them that.
author: Vic A.

description:
San Francisco's best kept secret.

This place is amazing! I've never actually been IN the restaurant, but instead have always ordered it for takeout. I am convinced that it makes the best tikka masala in the city. I always order the lamb (Viva Goa: source organic chicken and I'll order from you every night), which is good, although you need a knife to cut up the chunks.
author: Christine N.

description:
If you want some delicious, warm, flavorful comfort Indian food, come here! 

Classics like butter chicken, chicken tikka masala are so very delicious. Their goan macaroni soup was a pleasant surprise that I ordered while sick once, and now can't help but get now every time I order from here!

Also, the staff is always so pleasant, friendly, and quick
author: Brette B.

description: Hands down, the best chicken korma in the city! Everything I've had from Viva Goa has been excellent and the service is great. Very friendly group.
author: Barry B.

description: Love their Lunch Buffet - lovely assortment of different dishes.  Nice service.  The naan isn't as good as others but overall - DEFINTELY the best cost effective Indian Lunch Buffet in city.
author: C. Dianne M.

description: We've order to go or for delivery from this neighborhood Indian restaurant several times and the food is good, on time, no complaints!
author: P S.

description:
Tasty catered lunch!

The chicken tikka masala was extremely yummy, and I like how the chicken xacuti was very tender :)

The sauce was amazing with rice and the soft naan. 

I also enjoyed the aloo gobhi very much. 

Definitely recommended!
author: Christina N.

description: It was very disappointing to know that they have the lowest food safety score.Their launch buffet was kind of ok. But half of them taste like frozen food. I like their naan. It's a casual place to have Indian food.
author: Rajna R.

description:
Amazing Goan cuisine .. which is hard to find.

We have had Indian all over the world, this place measures up.  Not a lot to look at as far as interior decorations but who cares... the food was outstanding. Best Vindaloo in a while.
author: Seth C.

description:
BEWARE! I have eaten here twice. The bald waiter tried to tamper with the bill and added 2 extra dishes. Even after telling him to fix the bill he came back with another extra charge on the bill.

Also there chicken isn't fresh. It was chewy and low quality. Avoid this place at all costs
author: Swapnil S.

description: Delicious spicy chicken xacuti with thin naan , the naans were the best because they weren't thick . The pork sorpatel was average. Good service. Definitely recommend this place.
author: Dev B.

description: I've been here several times over the last few months for their weekend buffet.   It's always excellent!  Nice friendly service.
author: David R.

description:
Viva Goa is our go-to spot for Indian food in the city! The food is always fantastic, the service attentive, the staff friendly, and the prices reasonable. 

While we typically opt for the chicken tikka masala, navrattan korma, and saag chana, we've sampled many other dishes and they're all delicious: chana xacutti, bengan bertha, saag aloo, raita, vegetable samosas, chai, etc. Dishes can be adjusted to your acceptable level of spiciness too (mild, medium, hot), which is great. 

I love taking friends and family here when they're in town because the food is great, the prices aren't bad, and it's always easy to get a spot, no matter the size of your group. It may not look like much from the outside, but the interior of the restaurant is cozy with booths and tables, white tablecloths, and traditional Indian music always on the play list. Nicholas, Joseph, and the rest of the team are always happy to see us, helpful, attentive, and interested in how we've been - can't beat feeling like a regular!

Delivery is also super quick (which may be because we live nearby); if they quote us 40 minutes it usually arrives in 20-25, which is always a welcomed surprise. 

Cannot recommend Viva Goa highly enough!
author: Brendan C.

description: Food selection is great.  Carpet needs to be replaced as I can smell the trapped dirt or dust from being old. Other than that the food is very good. Everything was good. The gulab jamon was fresh and yummy.price for the buffet isn't bad.
author: Tess A.

description: When my princess GF forgot to order rice with our order hey we're very accommodating. The food is wonderful. Everything I wanted from delivery Indian food.
author: Elan E.

description:
This is a review for the lunch buffet.

I went a few times during the past month and the quality is consistant. You get fresh nan bread, a few salad options, a veggie korma dish, with tandoori chicken as well as a chicken tikka and seafood tikka dish to pick from along with pakoras and a few other items. Not a bad value for $8-9.

That being said , the seasoning for everything is "white bread" mild, I don't blame them for that since the buffet needs to cater to a wide range of customers. I wouldn't mind trying their dinner menu and turn the heat up a bit.
author: Kurt W.

description:
After an overly-long walk up/down the Presidio beach-y area searching for an event we never found (SF, you get on my last nerve), we yelped something near-ish for Indian food and found Viva Goa ranked highly among Yelpers.  I was a little nervous since I'm a big punjab-style fan and have never really taken to souther-style Indian food (seriously not a fan), and I wasn't sure what to expect with "Goan" style Indian.  I'm so glad we took the chance, because Viva Goa was simply delicious!  

They have lots of northern-Indian/Punjabi style favorites, so you can order good ol' standbys if you want (paneer, korma, tiki masala, etc.), We had the navratan korma, which was our "just in case" dish, and it was REALLY wonderful-- fresh, well spiced, very delicious.  But I'd highly recommend you try the Goa regional specialties (they have a little tree logo next to them), which are super well-flavored and really delicious.  We had the vegetarian caldin, which was light and tangy, while still rich in flavor/style.  Wonderful!  Also had their samosas, which were *very* flavorful (there are a shocking number of Indian restaurants who serve crap samosas-- why God, why?!?!).  We'll come here again next time we cross the bridge and venture into SF.

Tons of vegetarian options among the many meaty options, so vegetarians should have ZERO fear.  They also note that they can make many dishes vegan, so bring your crunchy friends with you ;)
author: Tarah D.

description:
After a long day of hiking/walking in the Presidio, my girlfriend and I were craving Indian food nearby and this place came up on Yelp. Dinner highlights:

Chicken Xacuti - one of their signature Goan dishes. Unique flavor with just the right amount of kick. Perfect with rice and naan... this is a must try!!
Mango Lassi - refreshing and not overly sweet.

We also ordered garlic naan, basmati rice and a seafood masala which were all delicious. Portions were just right and the staff was very polite and friendly. I was surprised at how empty it was for a Saturday night - we practically had the whole restaurant to ourselves. Parking was very easy to find on Lombard.
author: Josh L.

description:
This place is great. Good service and tasty food.

They also have free delivery with orders over $25 from Eat24. You almost exactly hit the minimum with two entrees, naan, and rice. 

I'd recommend the Chicken Korma if you don't want something spicy.
author: Jared R.

description:
I live in the area and tend to dismiss anything on Lombard as serving crap tourists want and won't have time to complain about. Viva Goa is a major exception.

We get delivery for dinners and frequent the lunch buffet a few times a month. My husband and I like to do family meetings here over the delicious spread of Indian dishes. I love that they serve fresh naan with each buffet order and love the price and quality.

The staff is warm and attentive. We especially like Simon who greets our family by name when we come in.

The decor could use a little updating but then the prices wouldn't be as great. Not a bad compromise.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Had the prawn xacuti, lamb rogan josh, naan and rice.

The prawns were cooked right, although the xacuti was not my thing (was recommended by our hotel manager), friend loved the rogan josh, the basmati was the winner for me.

Service was good, they forgot to charge me for my king fisher (nice light beer) and thanked me profusely for being honest (isn't everybody?)

I'd go back to try the all you can eat lunch buffet, seems like a good price, and if you're in the area, it's a solid place.
author: Mira T.

description: Good food.. We had buffet and it was worth it!! The fish curry was the best ... Very good option if you looking for both veg and non veg food at one place...
author: Nazneen R.

description: First time I came for the all you can eat, I wasn't very impressed. Let's just leave at that. This time around! Super impressed! Everything looked, smelled, and tasted fresh and good! I seriously tried everything due to how fresh everything was. Hopefully my many more visit will give me the same experience. Fantastic job nonetheless.
author: Jackie B.

description:
We started with Viva's famous Muligatawani Soup, which is essentially a Delicately blended spiced lentil soup (which they make themselves), and truly remarkable, perfectly cooked. My friend and I shared one order, which consisted of six full spoons yummy soup. We certainly could have shared a second order, but moved on to main course. 

For the main course, I decided to go with Viva's chicken Biryani which has well popular in India especially in Hyderabad. The flavor of the chicken and bright colors of the ingredients peeking through the thin rice paper made it a feast for the eyes as well as the stomach. My friend ordered white rice with Dal fry , which consisted of Yellow lentils seasoned in mild spices and cooked with garlic, ginger and onions. The meal was served perfectly. There were a few drinks, but we ordered for a beer to accompanied with the meal.
author: Narendra G.

description: I love this place!!! Get the Fish Masala Fry and you'll become a regular here like me. The buffet is also awesome if you like having a lot of bites of things. I love this place so much I'm going to Goa because I just love Goan seafood and want more of it! The owners are so sweet and take such good care of you, too. This place is never crowded. You can come in with friends and have a long leisurely dinner without your waiter giving you the stink eye.
author: Julie N.

description:
Awesome restaurant with Goan food on the buffet along with other Indian dishes in the Marina district of San Francisco

Goa is a region of India that has great food influenced by the Portuguese during their colonization of Goa.  Goa has no comparison anywhere on earth for the food, the music, the friendliest and most laid back people and some of the best beaches on earth.

We came for the lunch buffet, so I wont bother with the review except to say the buffet has at least 2 goan dishes, focus on these.

I suggest you come back for dinner and only order Goan seafood dishes as per your taste profile. you will definitely not regret it if you can eat a bit of spicy food.

You might go thinking this is any indian restaurant, but you will discover the cuisine of Goa and then life will never be the same again
author: Oculus C.

description: Favorite indian restaurant in the city.  They use fresh quality ingredients.  The seafood curry in particular seems to be their speciality - loved the fish curry and the fact that my toddler son gobbled it all up (he's quite the picky eater).  Been to the restaurant but also started to get delivery from here.  It seems like SF residents haven't quite discovered this place.  Used to hit up Little Delhi delivery quite a bit but this place is better.
author: Annie Y.

description: The Chicken or Lamb Korma is fantastic. One of the best Indian places in the city.
author: Sara P.

description:
Wow& wow. I' m Indian and I avoided this place for a long time given that it was located on the the tourist/ motel strip of Lombard St. However, we went for it last night and this is a diamond in the rough. I ordered from the menu but I hear the buffet is good too. Granted I can only eat so much but me and my boyfriend covered a few classics. 
Known for it's seafood we went for it. Prawn xacuti, tandoori fish and channa saag. 
The curry had ' flavour'! The fish was cooked to perfection- sole. Then the icing on the cake, for me, and I know my Indian desserts... The Rasmalai. I've grown up on that stuff in the UK and theirs was home made and flavourful enough for me to come back if only for dessert!!
There are definitely more classic dishes to try but the food and service here overall warrant my return... Soon
author: sup d.

description:
A friend introduced us to this place and from the first time we dined here, we were sold. As meat lovers, there's plenty of options and we have never been disappointed with the food. 
The Fish Masala fry is to die for, we also tried the different lamb curries - the lamb meat was cooked to perfection. Other good things on the menu - Chicken vindaloo, their goan dessert - Bebinca, and also their mango lassi and masala chai.
This is the closest to authentic Goan food that I've ever had, and I'm so glad it is right here in San Francisco!
author: Soumya G.

description: Delicious  food and friendly staffs. Goan  flavors are mouth watering and we loved everything about the restaurant.
author: Kalyan T.

description:
Ordered for pickup. Everything was delicious and perfect temp to eat when arriving home. 

Fish curry. Light buttery fish in coconut curry sauce. I could eat this forever.  I have NEVER had a fish curry that I enjoyed. I'm not even a big fish fan...but this, you must try this. Tasted caught this morning fresh. Garlic Nan, very garlic-y and soft, thin, delicious. On the smaller side, one order of nan per person small. 
Chicken Tikka Masala. Great, tasty, lots of chicken pieces.

There are cheaper Indian spots in the city sure, but you get what you pay for. I've also been to much more expensive places, and I'd go to this place over all but one of those.
author: Alize A.

description: My mom is native Goan and we all thought the food was fantastic! The mussels, fish masala fry and prawns ambot tik all impressed us. Quality service, a nice atmosphere, and a wonderful dinner. If I could give it more stars I would!
author: Meghana N.

description:
If you are not from Goa and do not understand what spicy means over there, I'd recommend asking for mild.  If you eat a lot of spicy Indian food, ask for medium.  

Xacutis are reasonably authentic and the food is great, with side of Kingfisher.
author: Vipul V.

description: Wonderful service. Great and friendly staff. Feel free to ask them about the history of the place and about Goa.
author: Oliver L.

description: I did not like the food... firstly the fish cutlets is actually tuna cake with a really bad taste... we ordered variety of stuff like chicken lamb and fish... and there was nothing u could say yummmy to...
author: Pritika M.

description:
Pros

$9.99 lunch buffet
Dope Mango lasse
Fresh naan

Cons

No Indian music?
Limited options (inc bland chicken)
Cockroaches

This venue appears to be converted from another restaurant because it lacks any Americanized (or non) Indian styled location I've ever seen. It is really nice though. All my above comments are based on a buffet visit. So if you're looking for more sit down related reviews: skip.
author: David W.

description: Terrible place! The staff is extremely rude, the man behind the counter is mean and their food does not justify such bad attitude at all...
author: DVolt B.

description: hated the food. Dont even know where to start. The quantity is fine but the taste and quality are meh.
author: Bhavya S.

description: Free delivery was convenient, order was delivered on time and with a smile. Prices were reasonable as was the selection and most importantly food was great. Would definately order again
author: Cedncal M.

description: The place looks a bit like a dive from the outside and a bit of the same way from the inside. The bathroom is semi-clean and it looks like a 5th grader piece together the toilet and the sink. However, the food was very good and the staff were very good also. The portions are deceptive. They look small but they are very, very filling. This is the third time we have eaten here and we will continue to return. On a side note, we brought our daughter-in-law with us who is also Indian. She is from a different area of India but also found the food very much to her liking. I would highly recommend that people come check this out
author: John Z.

description:
04.27.14 etc. | bookmarked 11.11.10

I LOVE this place. It's my go to Indian place. To eat in or take out.

Signature dish: paneer tikka masala. Onion naan. Garlic naan.

Done.
author: Jenny L.

description: Didnt like it..not at all authentic goan food .. i was so excited when v visited sf bcz f goan sea food but disapponited .. fish and prawns wer fresh but i wish they ll make some improvement with their goan curries ...
author: Siddhi M.

description: Found this place on Yelp the outside I was kind of iffy about it but when we went in it was decent looking and we were immediately greeted and seated. My dad asked how much was for my toddlers 1 and 2 he said free and my motto is "If it's FREE that's ME"  Great customer services, great waiters, and great food
author: Princess V.

description:
Tried Goan dishes that we are used to and were satisfied with the overall taste and quality of food. We had been to Gajalee in SF before and really liked the food but wanted the Goan twist :)
The Bombay to Goa in Sunnyvale was a really massive disappointment in both taste and quality, so we were really happy to finally find this place .
author: Dhaval L.

description:
For some reason, all my closest Indian friends are South Indian. Through our foodie adventures, I have developed quite an obsession with the cuisines of this region. When I discovered the existence of Viva Goa, I was determined to make the several-mile trek up to the Marina because it had been ages since I'd had Goan food (and I've gotten kind of sick of the same old Westernized North Indian dishes).

My friend and I came here for lunch. She opted for the lunch buffet, but I decided to go a la carte because the buffet only had 2 Goan dishes (both of which weren't terribly exciting) and I wanted something authentically and uniquely Goan that I wouldn't be able to find at other Indian restaurants. 

After some consultation with the very friendly Goan owner, I chose the Prawn Xacutti. If you only have room in your brain to remember one Goan dish, let it be Xacutti, the definitive curry of Goa. It differs from other curries by having poppy seeds as part of its flavoring. I chose the prawn version because Goa, which is right on the coast, is famous for its wide variety of seafood dishes (particularly fish and shellfish). The xacutti was thick and tasty, with a complex multi-layered variety of spices, and the prawns were large, succulent and perfectly cooked. Combined with a generous portion of basmati rice and freshly baked, piping hot naan, and this meal could have easily fed two. 

I also tried some of my friend's Goan Fish Curry (one of the two Goan dishes at the buffet). The fish (some kind of white fish) was very tender, reminiscent of the way Chinese people cook fish, but the curry was rather watery and the flavors seemed diluted. For dessert, my friend and I split the Bebinca, a traditional Goan dessert made with flour, sugar, ghee and coconut milk (which gives it most of its flavor). Bebinca reminds me a lot of Chinese Thousand-Layered Cake, my favorite dim sum sweet. Both desserts are traditionally baked in layers. Viva Goa's Bebinca was very thick, with an almost paste-like consistency, and had the delicious flavor of coconut mixed with caramel. It was served with whipped cream. We both really liked it, but couldn't finish more than half because it was so rich.

There are no shortage of great restaurants in the Marina, but if you're looking for something off the beaten path, might I suggest Viva Goa?
author: Josephine L.

description: For $11 all you can eat it's serves its purpose.  The food was warm or hot, place was clean, and servers were friendly.  For $11 what more can you ask for in the city?
author: Michael I.

description:
Had their lunch buffet and it was a decent set menu. Coming originally from Goa, I must say these guys have done a good job with the authenticity not just in the food but also in the ambience. 
The two stars I deducted are for the cold pakoras I got and the not so well made potato. It tasted as if the vegetable was burnt. The Goan fish curry is worth a try and so is the chicken vindaloo! However one thing I truly missed as a Goan was the solkadhi.. They should think about including it in their buffet!
author: Kimaya K.

description:
I came here for the lunch buffet with a few friends and we all really enjoyed the food. My best friend is a sucker for naan and he must have eaten two or three basketfuls while we were there. I'm not particularly familiar with Indian cuisine on the details, but as a newbie I can say that I tried a little bit of everything and really enjoyed it all. 

The ambiance is pretty nice and the waitstaff was really attentive, asking how things were doing, and we were probably asked a few times if we wanted to order something besides water to drink.
author: Maureen C.

description: Absolutely loved the lunch buffet. Every dish i tried (most of the hot dishes on offer) was delicious. The included fresh naan was great too (we had two orders :) If i had one tiny grievance, it's that they were slow to refill dishes - i gave up on waiting for more fish curry, which i wanted (but certainly didn't need) more of!
author: Erica W.

description: I randomly found this restaurant while walking around Lombard St. and I was very pleased with everything that I ate.  I had the Lamb Korma, Garlic Naan and Mango Lassi.  They were delicious and the service was excellent.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for awesome Indian cuisine down in the Marina District.  Their menu is very extensive.
author: Ricardo S.

description: Amazing good reasonably priced and great service. The samosas and naan are to die for.
author: Natalie C.

description:
I don't yelp a lot. I don't hand out 5 stars a lot. But when I'm not drinking beer, I go to Viva Goa. This place won me over big time--hands down best indian food in the city.

Such flavors.
The Goan special shrimp appetizer...I cleaned the plate. That sauce was amazing.
The chicken korma was exactly how a korma should be. Thick, delicous creamy sweet sauce. 
Garlic Naan is average at most places, theirs was definitely above average in taste. Could have been a bit fluffier. On the thin side for naan.

I love this place and will be coming here once a week and ordering extras for lunch. Viva Goa for sure.
author: Parker K.

description:
Goa....the Costa Brava, the Ibiza, the coastal vacation spot and getaway of India!

First time here a few Fridays ago.... I'd say a fair 2.7 for dining experience and 3.2 for the food.

Was just disapponted with my experience there overall. We had rez for 2030. A dinner of one onion naan (which came out so flattened, we were both in disbelief a bit)...

Prawns sungttam were tasty... bit overcooked though. Enjoyed the flavor. 

The spiced sole fish xacuti entree and the Goan lamb masala dish. I agree with Natalie S' review... better than average, but just not good enough for my palate...lamb was overcooked. And even though my fish wasn't, the spices were a bit confused, overlapping one another, and wasn't bowled over. 

Too many elements were missing to have tacked on an 18% auto gratuity for a place in disrepair and oft-neglected in ambience. This considering the prices they charge.

Not sure i could muster a re-visit here, although our servers (both Goan) were friendly and courteous. Mess up on a few things ordered (i.e. a Taj, not a Kingfisher)....

PS Near the Super 8 on north side of busy Lombard.
author: Jana C.

description:
Viva Goa has great food. Don't let the exterior, or interior for that matter, deter you. The service is very friendly although my interaction with them is primarily over the phone for delivery or briefly in person for take out. 

They have very tasty Goan dishes that range from super spicy to mild.

I really like the tandori chicken tikka, vindaloo (although it is really tasty, its too spicy for me), the saag paneer and the lamb and veggie Biryanis are also a go to dish.  Love the samosas too!

My only negative thing I can say is their fairly small delivery radius.  I live in South Beach which is understandably not the closest to this place so I have to encourage friends who live nearby to order when we decide to eat in or just go pick it up if I'm in the area.
author: Derek S.

description: Food is descent but they do not use fresh ingredients, using  frozen vegetables in their dishes, the naan tastes like it is from the freezer and the samosas are covered in salt.
author: Nick G.

description: I geniuanly enjoyed this spot - if I could give it a 3.5, I would. I didn't go for the lunch buffet so I can't speak to that but the dinner was a good experience overall. The service was perfect - our server was attentive, nice and comical. My three star rating is simply because of the food quality for the price - it was good but not something I would go out of my way to have.
author: Chelsea A.

description:
We live a few blocks away from Viva-Goa and love it. The staff is friendly, the food is yummy, and prices are great too. I highly recommend going in for a buffet on a weekend or even during the week because you'll get to sample the various Goan dishes. 

If you're not a buffet-kind of person, then any of their Xacutis and Vindaloos are a good choice, and do get their Naan. Their Naan's are soft and thin, unlike the Naans at North Indian/Pakistani restaurant - that's because they don't add eggs to their Naan dough. 

Goan food isn't very readily available in the bay area (or in the US in general), and so we are lucky to have one such restaurant in our neighborhood.
author: Amit J.

description: Simple but enchanting and quiet atmosphere with delicious food, great service and reasonable prices. Spiciness to taste, they really know how to gauge it! Can't wait to go back!
author: Ashley H.

description:
Not sure about other times but buffet was very average. Not sure who gave this place 4??? Average food!
Very limited variety of food and they were taking forever to replenish the dishes even though it wasn't even busy.
author: R K.

description:
This is not the typical Indian restaurant you find everywhere... which I love as well.

Never had Goan Indian Food (Portuguese influenced)... very yummy!
But the Goan spices are unique and a welcome change.

Service here was good, and the place is filled with takeout call in service.
Mango lassi drink was thick milkshake like with good mango taste, good quality.
Garlic Naan could be more garlicky for those true garlic lovers.
Very reasonably priced for the quality.

Fish platter was most excellent.

I will be back (1st time here)
author: David H.

description: The food is really good and delicious I really enjoy it.Although,the customer service I recieved was not as good.The food is super tasty,but I would not count on the service as much..
author: Jenny D.

description: Good food, service is really, really nice. You feel like you at a restaurant. Decor is a little dated but it can be charming too. A lot of people take carry out.
author: Natalya V.

description: This is my go to place for yummy Indian food. The curries are flavorful without being too greasy. The samosa were also tasty but top salty. Mango lassi a bit too sweet for me. Definitely coming back!
author: Margaret H.

description: Great food (I had the lamb xacuti, my husband had the lamb vindaloo and my friend had a chicken tikka). My husband's vindaloo nearly blew my head off (the spice is off the charts even for me and I love spicy food). But it is crazy hot so be sure to ask about the level of spice in the food especially if you are not used to it. Very reasonably priced and something a little different given how touristy Lombard Street is.
author: Dawn W.

description:
Viva Goa is a good Indian restaurant that could use the services of a restaurant consultant. What I like about this place is that you feel kind of like you're sitting in a family living room. The service is friendly and unpolished, and you can enjoy your meal without worrying about putting your elbows on the table. The food is above average Indian cuisine, with yummy chicken tikka masala, naan, jasmine rice, and other staples.

The reason I take off one star is because of the delivery procedure. Since this is one of the few restaurants that delivers to my house, I order from them a lot, sometimes twice in a week. I've been doing that for months, and yet each time the guy who takes orders picks up the phone, it's as if I'm a brand new person he's never met before. I literally order the same thing every time and yet he still brings me through the same 6 scripted questions (I can recite them) and then makes me spell my name and address. Often he will misspell the name of my street ("Pilbert Street?"), which, aside from the fact that I've spelled it for him 80 times, is located 2 blocks away from his restaurant. Sometimes I feel like shouting into the phone "Dear God, man!  Where has your memory gone?? Lay off the ganja pipe for a while!"

Viva Goa: please get a computer. It's 2014. They have some great technology out now.

This restaurant needs to take a page out of Escape from New York Pizza's book. When I call, their caller ID links me to my address. They ask me what I want, confirm my address, and I am literally off the phone within 30 seconds.
author: Evan B.

description: We took uber and went and saw closed board written on paper with pen on Tuesday afternoon, really disappointing. Finally ate at curry leaf , Indian restaurant very good food and friendly staff.
author: capriconrulez c.

description:
I've eaten at Viva Goa and had delivery from them a few times. Mostly it's been pretty good but we had a delivery last weekend that was so bad I have to post a review.

Maybe the main chef was off for the day or something but the quality took a major nosedive. The tandoori fish was some kind of cheap spongy fish and really tasteless. The Vindaloo tasted as if it had ketchup in it. Overall the flavors just weren't there and the quality of the ingredients seems to have dropped considerably.

Hope they improve again soon.

PS. the "pickle" and mango "chutney" were a watery insult to the palate.
author: Dilbo G.

description: I ordered vegetable vindaloo. They really make it Goan style. This is one reason whenever I visit California I come eat this item. I am having hard time finding veg vindaloo in other places. Although garlic naan was little chewy and not soft. I will come back again.
author: Kunal D.

description:
Fellow goenkars,

If you're looking for a place to introduce the chicken-tikka-masala eating masses to authentic cuisine from the homeland, Viva Goa is the place to do it.  My eyeballs nearly popped out when I saw sorportel on the menu!  Delicious chicken xacuti, pork vindaloo, and the seafood platter are all winners in my book.

For the uninitiated,

Put down that naan and rogan josh.  Set aside the daals, the saag paneer.  For gods sake, stop eating that samosa.  Goa is known for its seafood, its coconut-based dishes, its spicy cuisine, so take full advantage of these strengths.  Help yourselves to the Goenchim Sungttam (a prawn appetizer) or the chicken lollipops.  If you're down with heat, order up the pork vindaloo, otherwise the Chicken Xacuti can serve as a flavor-bomb alternative.  I personally haven't had the Rechado Pomfret Fish or the Chicken Cafreal here, but those are both super super good if done well, as is the sorportel.

I'll be back, fo sho.  And hopefully they'll have feni and limca on the cocktail list :)
author: Raoul C.

description:
I always hesitate upon entering empty restaurants. We sauntered in here one evening on our way back from Marin on a freezing cold day when we were craving hot, homely goodness.

Ah, chai and Indian coffee to the rescue! Even better with fresh vegetable pakoras! Amazing start to the meal.

For the main course, we decided to stick with Goan specialties, being in a Goan restaurant. We ordered the fish curry and the chicken xacuti, accompanied with plain naan. The fish curry was slightly bland for my taste and the curry element slightly thinned-out and translucent. I'm not sure if that is the intended preparation, but it definitely could've used a tad bit more masala. Overall though, the fish was fresh and didn't leave an aftertaste. The chicken xacuti was plenty flavorful. Similar to a standard Indian chicken curry, it included a few nontraditional spices.

Overall, a nice place to dine and friendly customer service. I can definitely see this being a regular spot for residents in the neighborhood. It seems like a chunk of the business is delivery, hence the quiet restaurant.
author: Mansi A.

description:
I had the lunch buffet on a Sunday and it was superb. Tasted very fresh. The rice was perfect. I tried goat for the first time and it was delicious.

Service was prompt and friendly.

I completely recommend this place.
author: Brian B.

description: Pretty nice indian place  for lunch , tasty tikka masala , rise is normal , samosa is not very tasty , bread is awesome . Lunch for two came out extremely cheap from buffet 25 dol
author: Maria O.

description:
Marina Beach.

Traveled to Goa for this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mqMy3fpzlb8

Traveled to the Marina for this: Clay oven cooked Goan special platter of assorted seafood, chicken and veggies. Impressive quantity. Really impressive flavor.

Barely a hint of oil like this two star disappointment: http://www.yelp.com/biz/great-india-restaurant-san-francisco#hrid:BuQAn0ZTcm4rS6Gfp6XgDA

Only additive was a squeeze of lemon and their assorted sauces as everything was placed in freshly baked roti and enthusiastically enjoyed. No need for anything else.

Service was friendly and attentive, prices reasonable at $14.99 + tax/tip. Atmosphere didn't stand out but everything else certainly did.

Both the music and the food were well worth the trip.
author: Jason B.

description: There was nothing decent in the lunch buffet. The food felt stale and the drinks were subpar .
author: Anupam K.

description: Delicious lunch buffet w/Goan specialties as well as more traditional Indian dishes. The selection is always changing. The fresh naan is brought right to your table and the staff is very friendly.
author: Stephanie M.

description: If wish there would be more stars to give! I ordered my foot via Eat24. It was delivered very promptly and it was simply amazing! Very juicy pieces of chicken in a Tikka Massala and Saag that melt in your mouth. Tandoori Chiken was great too. Fluffy rice! Yummy samosas.  I am impressed by the quality of this food. I hope it never changes.
author: Laurie P.

description:
Got delivery from them.  Pretty great!
Can't believe half the indian joints in SF don't serve raita, but this one does and it is great and comes complimentary I think.

Highly recommend.
author: Alex A.

description: This place was so good. The rice was perfect, the samosas were quite possibly the best I have ever had and my saag paneer was solid. Naan was not the puffiest that I've ever had but it was fine. Service was impeccable, speed was fantastic and the atmosphere was quiet. Wish I lived next door...well...maybe not because then I would be ten thousand pounds.
author: Christina B.

description: Whenever I have a craving for indian food, Viva Goa is my go to. My favorite items are the Butter Chicken, Malai Kofta, and Chicken Tikka Kebabs. The flavor is great and if you like spicy (which I don't) they can definitely spice it up for you upon request. Their naan isn't the greatest. It's a little chewy and thin, but that's about the only bad thing I've experienced with them. Delivery is usually prompt and quick so no issues there. Average pricing for an Indian restaurant, for my wife and I it usually ends up costing around $40-$50 for food, but it lasts us a few meals so kind of evens out in the end. Highly recommend.
author: Amit P.

description:
The chicken lollipops here are awesome and  so is the prawn xacuti and the goenchim sungttam and Goan chicken masala. The chicken cafreal lacks a little bit of spice and the paneer pakora seemed just a little bland.  We had the bebinca for dessert, but pretty much all 12 of us didn't like it - doesn't mean it's not authentic, just that the taste didn't do it for us. 

The service was excellent and the staff was very accommodating to us, despite a getting there very late and then staying past the restaurant closing hours.
author: Archit L.

description: After a exhausting long bike ride over the bridge we were starving and wanted to eat quick and super close. This place was right next to our hotel. It was so delicious! Amazing tandoori chicken and the best chicken masala! The samosas were so good as well as perfectly delicious garlic naan. Service was excellent and food taste very fresh! I would definitely come back
author: Sheena O.

description:
Very home style food 
Just what we needed after a long flight in from Boston, beaten tired and HUNGRY

The chicken tikka masala gravy, the dal fry, the stir fry cabbage vegetable -- not too greasy, perfectly and authentically spiced - not made insipid to suit international palette. Just right. Bibingka dessert was heavy but good. Skip the gulab jamun. Price is right!!
author: Mridu D.

description: Used to be frequently in this neighborhood but never stopped in this restaurant. My loss! The place is fantastic. Some of the best Indian food I have ever had. The family also loved their selections and for San Francisco this was not a bad price either. The service was friendly and prompt.
author: David M.

description: Amazing Indian food! Totally loved the buffet! Chicken Tandoori and Fish Curry are highlights! Service is exceptional!
author: Daya sagar N.

description: I had our food delivered and it arrived Hot & Delicious!  Everything we ordered was amazing--I would defiantly order from this restaurant again. I'm now a fan!
author: Lucillia C.

description: This is by far one of better Indian especially Goan place I visited outside India. Being from west part of India, I can confirm place is very authentic when it comes to Goan flavor. Nice music, no added soda, perfect spice and aroma, hot and fresh ingredients and vey friendly staff. Whenever I am in the city I will come to this place time and again.
author: Adi S.

description:
Came here after a Yelp event around the corner since I was craving Indian food. The food was not that impressive considering this place has a solid 4 stars rating. It's a nice white tablecloth, somewhat romantic place. Service was nice, but the food just didn't wow me.

- Mulgatawni Soup: not bad, lots of spices, and not too chunky
- Tandoori Chicken: dry, lacked flavor
- Goan Lamb Masala: good, flavorful, big chunks of meat
- Garlic Naan: good and chewy texture
author: Linda C.

description:
I came while they were offering the lunch buffet. There were only two other people eating there, though admittedly they had just opened maybe twenty minutes prior. The buffet had things like veggie pakora, mattar paneer, aloo gobi, channa, gulab jamun...there were also a couple meat dishes, one Goan specialty too, so there is plenty for vegetarians and non vegetarians alike.

The staff were very warm, friendly, and attentive. There's parking on the street if you can find a spot.

I recommend it for lunch, and would like to go back during non-buffet hours to see what else they have.
author: Alex K.

description:
San Francisco's best kept secret. Best place to try out goan cuisine. I recommend the the pork sorpotel, goenchim sungtam, chicken cafreal, and the prawn xacuti. Awesome fare. I wish somebody had told me about this place earlier.

The server patiently answered all our questions and helped us decide what to get.

Here are a few tips if you are new to Goan or Indian cuisine:
Don't order  dishes from other parts of India like tandoori or paneer  dishes. Ask the server to help you choose Goan dishes. (the same way you wouldn't order Italian at a Portuguese restaurant)

If you are a vegetarian, you may not have too many Goan options.

Goan food is influenced by Portuguese cuisine and so some dishes like the vindaloo have a sweet and sour taste

For dessert, try the bebinca - 1 plate is enough for about 2-3 folks.
author: Sanjay V.

description:
My Favorite Neighborhood Indian joint! Been here a dozen times with family and friends to celebrate everything from law school graduation to birthdays.

FOOD:
This is not your typical Indian restaurant. Their specialty is Seafood and Goan curries with coconut or fish in it. They also have specialty dishes like Chicken Xacuti which are worth a try. The lunch buffet is great and gives you a chance to try a nice variety for under $15/person.
*They used to have these amazing chicken and veggie wraps but they're not on the menu anymore. :( Bring them back!!

SERVICE:
The service is not terribly slow but the owners here are so friendly and kind and a pleasure to chat with every time I dine here or pick up food!

AMBIENCE:
It's a bit dark in here but spacious and comfortable.

-Hungry Hungry Pongy

*keep up the great work, Nicholas and Joseph and see you soon!
author: Sangita A.

description:
Amazing food!! I went to this one because the usual sea food restaurant Gajalee had closed for good.. But i found a better replacement now:)
If you love sea food goan style.. A definite visit! 
The staff was nice and polite too.
author: Viddhesh B.

description: Loved the food. Ate here four times. First time xacuti chana and dal fry. Chicken lolipop is amazing and the best part are the cheese pakoras. Buffet is good for people who want to try all. I tried lamb bhunna fry. The lamb was not cooked. But the gravy was amazing. So if u want to try it. Just tell them to cook it little more. Service is excellent staff is great. Do try the navratan koorma. Only thing is the vindaloo they make isn't authentic vindaloo. Its more of a spicy tomato curry but still tastes good. I would recommend this over any other indian restaurant in bay area. Cheese tikka are also great for vegetarian people. The lamb chops are amazing here. All Goan restaurants make these dishes amazing. Just like my mom did.
author: Jake L.

description: Authentic goan prawn curry. Good ambience. The buffet option is also great.. Great value for money..
author: Siddhesh R.

description: Awesome place. Feels like a really expensive restaurant but prices are mostly ~$15. Waiters are super nice.
author: Marlon M.

description: I've never been to Goa, but if this restaurant is anything to go by, I love Goan food.
author: ramesh g.

description:
My friend had picked this place through Yelp and from the outside, it looked casual but once you walk in, the setting is romantic and clean for an Indian restaurant (probably because they just opened for 7 months now) The waiters were in proper attire (black dress shirt and tie). We were the first customers since we got there when they had just opened for dinner so I could not tell if it was a popular restaurant til an hour later, more people arrived. 

I had the Mango Lassi (Best ever! Must have!), Beef cutlets (in Goa they dip with ketchup) and Paneer Tikka Masala. Prices were reasonable and not only was the food presentation nice (Tikka Masalas come in clay pots) it was Delicious! I have to say it is the Best Indian/Goan restaurant ever! And I had not heard of Goa before so it was nice to learn. Menu also has many choices! Waiter also gave us Rice pudding on the house!
author: Sylvia P.

description:
Food:   5
Value:   5+
Service:   5
Ambiance:  3

Viva Goa is incredibly consistent in the high quality of delicious food, warm service, and unbeatable value. 

In two years of living in the Marina, Viva Goa has become one of my favorite go to restaurants of any type.  They are worth a journey to visit.
author: Duke K.

description:
I hate this restaurant so much , first they never take a shower , they are always greasy and just with looking at their greasy hair , I loose my appetite , I used to go with my friend , because she likes the food ( she never had indian food anywhere else , so she had no idea about good food ) . I once ordered chicken biryani , and they brought me cold rice from their fridge  , when I told them they got mad at me , so when we went there next time , they gave me attitude .
another time , my friend was going to use buffet for lunch , but I wanted to order food from menu , so he told me that I can't have any bread from the one he already brought to our table , and he kept checking on me at our table to make sure that I am not having anything from my friend's food who was actually using they buffet , it was SO SO SO SO RUDE , they are very rude people , their food is just ok . WILL NEVER GO THERE AGAIN .
author: Mellany A.

description:
I really don't know much about Goa other than rumor of it's gorgeous beaches and that I need to visit someday.  What do I know about Goan cusine?  Again, nothing, really, but if the food at Viva Goa is representative of the actual place, then I'm sold!

As compared to the usual Indian/Pakistani haunts, the menu here contains a lot more seafood, some pork, some coconut based items, and quite a few dishes I'd never heard of.  Awesome. 

Chicken tikka masala- my favorite standby, delicious.  Garlic naan was on par with my favorite Tenderloin restaurant's.  Samosas-  standard, but not at all in a bad way.  And one Goan dish-  vegetable xacuti - lots of spicy deliciousness in there. 

Definitely trying this place again, and probably going for some seafood dishes too.  

They offer free delivery-  wait time was about an hour.  I can't tell you how glad we are to now have this place on our short list for delivery options in the city.
author: Joanne G.

description:
When I saw that at least half the buffet was your usual Punjab fare, channa masala, allo gobi, mattar pander, etc. I was bummed. I mean, hell, it says GOA on the sign! 

At least, it was good. In fact, I loved the okra masala. Excellent, attentive service. Reasonable price for lunch. I want to come back for dinner and try some dishes from the restaurant's namesake Indian state, Goa. Until then, three stars. Hoping for more!
author: James C.

description: We visited this restaurant to taste some authentic home style dishes from Goa. The food was great. Service was also very courteous especially since we landed at the restaurant about 15 min prior to closing. If you do go here, try the pork sorpotel. This is by far the best preparation I have had in a restaurant.
author: E G.

description: This is an amazing Indian restaurant. I have been there many times, for buffet, dinner or ordering delivery.  The butter chicken is great. The xacuti is excellent. If you like Indian food, this is a the place. Also note that this is a...Goan place and that they have a couple of beef dishes to check out. Service is fantastic and they are so friendly.  The location is not fancy but the food speaks for itself.  I am an Indian food fanatic and know all the best places in the Bay Area. This is top of my list. Watch out Amber India.
author: Christophe B.

description: What their actual Goan food may be like, I don't know, but their lunch buffet is your basic Indian stuff with some tasty curries (one with green beans, one with fish being the most unusual).  This was on the weekend so the price was more ($11), and hence the selection possibly better than during the week.  It wasn't the restaurant's fault that a large table of young women were having conversational fun so piercingly loudly that even at the far end of the room the noise was unbearable.
author: David B.

description:
We've been here a couple of times and I have to say I really like their curries. It's the closest to the curries I was used to living in the UK, which of course is renowned for having some of the best curries outside of India.

The service is top notch too!

One downfall of the restaurant is that they don't seem to be able to make proper fluffy Naan Breads. If they could improve that then I would definitely give them a five star rating!
author: Carl F.

description:
My sister and I came here a few days ago and we were very impressed by the food and the customer service. I ordered the Vegetable Caldin and my sister ordered the Vegetable Xacuti, which is a curry that is from Goa, India. 

We also ordered sides of rice, naan, and roti. We sampled each others' dishes and I prefer the caldin over the xacuti. It was DELICIOUS. This was some of the best Indian food I have ever had. 

The waiters and hosts were very kind and frequently made rounds to see if we needed anything throughout the duration of our meal. There was also a buffet going when we got there which looked like it had a lot of variety. 

My only problem with the place was that it was really stuffy and hot. When we left the restaurant and were hit with wind and fresh air I wondered why the heck the heat was on in there!
author: Taylor M.

description:
This place is awesome.  For the quality, the prices are more than reasonable.  Also, the owners are really friendly and will happily make your dish spicier if you request it.  

Recommended: Fish Curry, Chicken Tikka, Prawn Xacuti, Fish Ambot Tik 

(I'd add more but those are the only dishes we've tried so far.)
author: Dagmar H.

description: This is a review of their lunch buffet only. Was around on a Friday to eat and saw that they had a $9.99 lunch buffet. Was a little disappointed when walking in because it wasn't that large of a selection of items as well as not as tasty as I have had before. First, a couple of the dishes were not heated properly, the tandoori chicken was a little cold. The honey/milk/rice balls were warm. Only5 other dishes that were fairly standard but not impressive. There was no butter chicken or curry option other than a chicken tikka masala. Maybe I will come back to try the dinner selections and will be more impressed, then edit my review.
author: Lei A.

description: i defiantly recommend this place for those who love Indian food, this place is a very calm place to eat customer service is excellent. they have buffet during lunch hour, also nick the owner is very friendly and do care for there customers im planing to bring my wife there for a dinner thank you for the service.
author: Sod F.

description: This place is astoundingly delicious. We tried it for the first time tonight and the food melts in your mouth. I special ordered a fish tikka masala and it's the best I've ever had in my entire life. Whoa! I'm so pleased to know this places exists.
