We also got the chana masala, the baigan bhartha, and the saag paneer. Soooo good! I can't tell you enough how scrumptious this meal has been. If there were ten stars on Yelp, this place would get it!
author: Mei F.

description: Incredibly tasty saag channa and papadam! Very attentive courteous staff. Excellent quick service. The level of spice was ok, but the spicy seemed to be more of a hotter medium.
author: Noel W.

description: I have been to this restaurant a couple of times but this time I could not resist myself to write about them. I went to Viva Goa with my friends on Sunday night. Ambience of this restaurant is really good with rose and candle on the table. I went with two vegetarian and one non- vegetarian friend. After entering the restaurant all the staff members and owner as well greeted us with smile. We were suggested to try vegetable caldin and paneer tikka masala in veg and fish masala fry, chicken xacuti. Trust me best Indian food I ate so far. We were served with rice and garlic nan. Rice was aromatic and nan was crispy. After eating this much my friends were craving for some dessert. We decided to try pistachio kulfi and bibinca. Kulfi is milky Indian ice cream. And bibinca was traditional Goan sweet. Really enjoyed our dinner in Viva Goa. Overall best service, best food and best ambience. I will highly recommend Viva Goa to anyone looking for best Indian food in Bay Area. I know I will certainly be returning soon. Cheers
author: Roshan P.

description: Viva Goa is consistently good. It's our go to take out place and pretty much go to for Indian food. Every once in awhile we will actually eat at the restaurant. The staff is always pleasant and attentive. One of theses days I will make it to their lunch buffet.
author: Tiffany G.

description:
The 2 stars go for the good food I've had in the past. 
The missed three stars for the way you treated me today!

I am starving, call the restaurant to place a pick up order, guy takes my number and name and says he'll call back. Waited and waited and no call. I AM STARVING!!!!

Anyway, he calls while I was picking up food from another restaurant. 

Thanks a lot! You just lost one loyal and local customer who comes there often. Whatever it was you were doing or talking to was more important than attending to your customers.
author: E_sg I.

description:
My friend and I came here on Saturday after deciding on the cuisine and because of the sum of stars on Yelp. 

We were seated immediately and food came out pretty expediently.  My friend urged me to try something different, so I selected at his behest, the chicken vindaloo (medium), he the lamb basmati.  Holy SPICY! Apparently, I should've ordered mine mild! Spicy or not though it was sooooooooo very good. I then ordered the chicken tikka masala (what I usually order).  Don't look at me like that.  I didn't eat ALL of it! It was pretty tasty - but at comparing both sides of the fence, the grass was greener on the vindaloo side.  Don't get me wrong - the tikka masa was very good. 

The Garlic naan was some of the best I've encountered.

We left full (I'm sure you're shocked!) and happy.
author: Michelle C.

description:
As usual, when I have a wonderful dining experience I like to write a review about the restaurant here on Yelp.  Sadly, as much as I enjoyed the dishes we tasted at Viva Goa, I am going forego the review about our meal and rather write about my disappointment as they OVER CHARGED us for our meal and added a 30% gratuity to boot.  In addition, we had a $55 groupon for a pre-fix meal for two and although they honored the groupon, they did not have a pre-fix menu.  ???

What we ordered:
2 Veggie Simosa at $3.50 each
1 Goan Mussels at $7.99
1 Lamb Vindaloo at $10.99
1 Goan Chicken Masala at $9.99
1 Basmati Rice at $1.99
1 Raita at $2.50
1  Naan at $1.99
1 Garlic Naan at $2.99
1  Bottle of Wine at $18.99

Total should have been = $64.43 (I can add)

When it came time for our bill, we received an invoice that read

$55 
1 Basmati Rice
1Raita
1 Naan 
1Garlic Naan 
Gratuity $18.33
Total    $96.76
-$55.00
Due  $41.76

Now if our meal was a total of $64.43 + .05% health tax at $3.22 + .085% at $5.48, our total bill should be $73.13

Adding a 20% gratuity (WHICH AGAIN IS NOT MANDATORY AND IS ONLY A GESTURE) should have been $14.63

Which brings us to a grand ole total of $87.76

NOT $96.76

So why did we pay an additional $9.00; I do not know - it is a mystery to me. 

In closing, I'd like to say . . .

Dear sirs of Viva Goa - next time be prepared to honor what you solicit...  that is, if you offer a pre-fix meal for 2, HAVE A PRE-FIX MENU.

If not, then ITEMIZE YOUR BILLING INVOICE; do not just write a number and expect people to pay it.

Lastly, tipping is not, I repeat NOT MANDATORY and it should be to the discretion of your dining guest to decide what they feel is appropriate for tipping -which could be anywhere from 10%, 15% or 20%  

NOT 30% which is what you put on our bill!  Shame on you.  

I wanted to like you - but I will not return based simply on bad business practices.
author: Cris B.

description:
I WISH I COULD GIVE IT A 5! But the food wasn't spicy enough! Even though we ordered it super spicy. I'll admit my taste buds like it hotter than most peeps, but this was seriously nothing...not a single drop of sweat!

The service was superb! Always there for refills :) Very attentive! Always checking up on us, & giving great recommendations.

My bf and I went after going to the Exploratorium. We were a bit skeptical because the place was DEAD when we passed by. But, when I come to think of it...it was only 5 pm. It gets dark so quickly! Tricks my tummy into thinking it's dinner time! Lol. As soon as we were seated a bunch of parties came in! The place was popping!

The venue was nice - well lit [dim/diffused] - comfortable - & definitely spacious enough. All of the servers were very nice! Always checking up on us every time they passed by with big smiles on their faces. :] 

As an appetizer we ordered vegetable mimosas! They were ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! By far my favorite part of the meal. I'm sure I'm going to have cravings for these when I get back home to Hawaii. Crunch crispy goodness, with a hint of spice. 

We also ordered regular nan and rice - to go with our yummy chicken vindaloo! The sauce was a bit more saucey (versus being thicker) but it was still packed with a lot of spices. The dish was full of a lot of flavor! Just a bit more spicy and it would've been perfect. The tandoori chicken was good too, it was cooked in an oven - but the chicken was similar to BBQ chicken. Seasoning was good.  

The indian food wasn't as traditional - a little bit more of a modern spin. But overall I loved! VEGETABLE SAMOSAS ARE A MUST!!!!

I heard there is LUNCH BUFFET!!! Toooo bad. Next trip, I'm definitely trying it.
author: Megan R.

description:
Good stuff! Just might be my favorite Indian restaurant in SF (for the food, ambience is okay but I did a pick up to go order).  Malai Kofta and Chicken Tikka Masala were excellent and they understood what "spicy" meant.

Only negative is that the Mango lassi was a bit strong on the fake syrup so it was a wired orange color.  Still tasted like a typical restaurant mango lassi, so it was okay I guess but definitely not the place to go if you're hoping for an authentic fresh mango lassi.
author: Buddha B.

description:
Just stopped in for lunch, and I was very impressed.  Goan Indian food is distinctive from other regions because of the spices and the fish.  We had the lunch buffet, and were glad to have the staples of Indian food (samosas, dal and chicken tikka marsala) as well as some Goan specialties like the white fish and the spicy vegetables.  Ate to my heart's content, and had some tea to finish.  
The owners and wait staff were friendly, happy, and helpful.
author: UnitedStudios S.

description: This is the best Indian restaurant in the city. My husband always orders the chicken tikka masala and I get the malai kofta. We ask for spicy and they are always spot on with the spice. The flavorings are amazing, probably some of the best Indian food I've ever had. Our relatives also love the fish dishes here.
author: Chital S.

description:
I wasn't sure what to expect after reading some of the reviews but after a drink at Balboa, my beau and I decided to fill my insatiable appetite for Indian food here.  

AWESOME.  The BEST Indian food I've had in a while and I don't know what the other yelpers are talking about but the service was great!  I ordered Plain, Garlic and Paneer Na'an and they were really good.  We had all three of our curries medium hot to hot and it was just enough to break a sweat.  
 
You have to try the mango ice cream like thing for dessert.  It's like a frozen mango lassi but better.  We were stuffed to the brim with three curries, three na'ans and rice for two people but we found room for it at the end.  

DELICIOUS, REASONABLY PRICE, FAST AND DID I MENTION DELICIOUS?  I'm not Indian nor have I been to India but owning a hotel makes me an honorary Indian since that is all we eat at our corporate meetings.  It's good.
author: Suz L.

description:
Let me start off by saying that the service is absolutely first class. 

I had already eaten lunch, but I came here with my friend and ate a second lunch. This has been a reoccurring theme in my reviews. Ugh, even yoga can't save me now.

We had their all you can eat lunch buffet. For $8.99, you can't go wrong. It's not one of those horrible buffets where you get lettuce, soggy, nasty whatever have you, but it all seemed to be pretty legit dishes.  I can't even remember all the dishes, but the Goan fish curry stood out to me as the sauce was flavorful and the fish was uber juicy, if you can even describe fish as such.  I also really enjoyed this Chicken Mi---- (the name eludes me).  The garlic naan was piping hot fresh and crispy. MMmmmm!

Desserts--
We had this traditional Goan dessert: Bebinca, soo yum! It's made of refined flour, coconut milk, and egg yolk. Kind of reminds me of bread pudding, but better and layered. 

We also had their homemade pistachio ice cream. It's so frozen, but so creamy at the same time. How does that happen?

Did you know - one of the owners personally delivers food to your door if you order with them? That's pretty rare for an owner to do, so kudos to them!

Bottom line: I had no idea what or where Goa was, but I got a small history lesson, culinary lesson, and really great food.
author: Dolores L.

description: Hi ,Viva Goa Boys, I like to appreciate for your good food & service especially my wife like your Tandoori chicken & Recheado pompano fish, flavors were good and fish ,chicken was fresh & food was really good test ,thank you.
author: Francis F.

description:
I have the luxury of having my office cater my lunches everyday. It's really awesome because they bring in local restaurants and then I can try foods and then take my awesome boyfriend to these places at a later date. Unfortunately my guy is not a fan of Indian food, so whenever the office sends out an email saying were bringing in Indian Food, I get extra happy because I can get my fix in. 

Today was that kind of day, and I was fortunate to try Viva Goa. While I never had Goan food before, I was definitely open to it as it seems similar to what I have eaten at other Indian restaurants.

This place has awesome food. The spice in it was perfect for me (and I am a big fan of spicy food) and the flavors complimented the spice so well. They brought us the following: Vegetable Samosas, Goan Chicken Masala, Vegetable Caldin, Chana Masala, and Naan. I tried it all and loved everything. The Samosas definitely had more of a kick to them than anything so if you aren't down with spice, I would recommend opting out of them. 

I am not sure I will actually go and visit the restaurant considering it's in the Marina, and I live in the Sunset, and the boy isn't a fan of Indian Food, but that shouldn't stop you! If I can find an Indian Food buddy I will definitely make the trek out there. At least I can look forward to the next time my company sends an email telling me Viva Goa is catering lunch.
author: Diana R.

description: VERY good chicken tikka masala. Service was excellent. Restaurant and bathroom very clean. Good prices.
author: Julio L.

description:
Forget it!  Damn, I am so tired of the lack of service and communication.  On numerous occasions, buddies and I would call in an order for delivery and always have issues with the person on the phone.  They could never hear us on the phone and act as if it was the customers fault.  So tired of this crap! 

I do have to say the Samosas and butter chicken entrees were good, but the lack of service when ordering for delivery kills it.   To the owner - We will never order from you again!
author: Ryan M.

description: I never write reviews, but had to for this place. Everything about this meal was perfect. The staff is incredibly attentive, quick, and their recommendations off of the menu were fabulous. Shrimp appetizer, chicken lollipops and lamb vindaloo were all out of this world. We've also done takeout from here and that's been great as well.
author: Neda N.

description: Pretty solid Indian spot in the Marina.  Everything we had was excellent and very reasonably priced.  They also deliver which is a plus!  I will also say the service was excellent which only added to the experience.  This is definitely a place I will be back to without a doubt.  I recommend the Samosas, the Tandoori chicken and the garlic naan.  My sister had the Chicken Masala and that was very tasty as well.
author: Kirsten M.

description:
Worst Service EVER!!!!!!!!

The servers are ultimate RUDE and impolite!!! 

Talked to us very badly and not just one server....two!

Went in to celebrate Mothers day! Food came in so late......just because we wanted another table ( cause we had a toddler)..... They got so openly irritated! they did not change the table sheet, no fresh glasses, no silverware....had to ask for every single thing!...

WE WILL NEVER GO THERE AGAIN...n Will NEVER recommend it to anyone!

DID not enjoy the food cause of the service! such a horrible 'celebration' !
author: sindu m.

description:
Was looking for a food joint near exploratorium in sf and found this one on yelp with I think 4 stars ... Well I have never been so dissatisfied and disappointed by yelp reviews.

They took at least 15 mins to take our order and another 30 mins to bring it out and to top it all the food sucked 
 
Would not recommend this place to anyone
author: kungfupanda l.

description: Definitely a come-back place. Three of us shared Fish Ambot Tik (a "spicy and sour" Goan dish), Chicken Vindaloo, and Lamb Saag. Accompaniments: onion naan and garlic naan, and basmati rice. Each dish was unique and delicious, with lively spicing and plenty of sauce to sop up with naan. The naan was made in the tandoori oven and was beautifully crisped and hot - much better than any other Indian restaurant I have eaten in (and there have been many). The service was attentive, friendly and unobtrusive. The restaurant has a neighborhood feel, not overly upscale but nicely decorated and quiet. I highly recommend it.
author: Mari G.

description: It was recommended by a friend, and he was right the food is really good..indian-portugese cuisine.. Now my turn to pass the invitation to anyone who likes good curry and meaty food..
author: Marnie P.

description:
I have both discovered Goan food, and some of the best Indian I've found in SF.

Excellent seafood dishes, the spices are amazing and the service is fantastic.

I would go back here in a heartbeat :)
author: Jonathan B.

description: We consider ourselves pretty knowledgeable about Indian cuisine and have had more than our fair share of Indian restaurants - Viva Goa had a beachside twist to it, many seafood dishes here you wouldn't normally see... prawns and fish and things, we didn't order any of those. We had an average waiter who was nice, but too pushy with suggesting the Goan dishes and dessert at the end. Thankfully, the food made up for it. We ordered three vegetarian dishes: saag panner, the Goan chickpea dish, and the dark thakar dal. Also the cherry-nut stuffed naan, the potato stuffed naan, and mango pudding. Everything was completely delicious. Must-go!
author: Meralyn W.

description:
This is the place if you crave Indian food but do not want to be seen in yet another Chicken Tikka Masala factory.

This place is different, Goa different. The servers are authentic Goans, relaxed attitude, pony-tails and all. The menu has a smattering of exotic sounding foods ('Xacuti', 'Ambot Tik' anyone?) embedded in enough comfort Indian fare for those little less adventurous. It is easy to spot the Goan cuisine, they are the ones with an appropriate green Coconut tree clump icon on the menu. Perhaps green mary jane leaves would have served as well.

Food is yummy. Have no fear and order your Xacutis, Goan curries, Ambot Tiks or Vindaloos.

Tips: You can order the Ambot Tik with shrimps instead of fish off the menu. Do not, I repeat, absolutely do not, pass on the dessert, and order the Bebinca, it's nothing like you would get inside or outside an Indian restaurant. Remember to ask for some extra whipped cream with it, you will need that.
author: Sujoy G.

description: Just moved to SF and tried a bunch of Indian places in the city.  Nothing has compared to Viva Goa.  Probably some of the best Indian food of any state.  By far the best garlic naan and mango lassi I've had.  And the prices are affordable.  For $43 we were able to satiate two adults and couldn't even finish the cheese masala!
author: Emmanuel L.

description: Loved the ambiance of the place - small and intimate restaurant with white table cloths with red napkins and red roses, waiters wearing red shirts and black slacks. The staff was beyond nice and the food was incredible.
author: Magda G.

description: Excellent food. Homey little family restaurant on Lombard. Excellent for families early.
author: Joshua J.

description:
Dear Viva Goa,

Thank you for making me Paneer Tikka Masala, a most delicious dish.
Your prices are reasonable and you deliver to my door. I feel our relationship will only grow and flourish from henceforth.

Warmest regards,
Rachel
author: Rachel R.

description: Excellent, bit different and healthier than usual Indian fare.  Staff were very friendly.    Lots of vegetarian options.   Worth going of of your way for!!
author: David H.

description: Just came from lunch - the buffet is still very good (tasty, wide variety, fresh), the service good/friendly and the facilities/tables (each still with a fresh rose, which shows a certain level of care and pride) clean. Glad to know they're still around and are on top of their game. A very worthy unpretentious alternative to the more "upscale" places on Chestnut and Union where no real ethnic eats are to be found.
author: Es E.

description: lots of cream, not too healthy. good if you have a few bites but tummy will be hurting after.  good they deliver though.
author: Ethan M.

description:
The only unpleasant part of my experience at Viva Goa was having to listen to my fiance audibly moan in pleasure as she ate their food.   I haven't seen her that satisfied since the first few weeks of our relationship, when we both gave a shit.  

Seriously fantastic food, and spectacular service at a fair price.
author: Mr. Papshmir ..

description:
This is out go-to Indian takeout!

Highlights: garlic naan, butter chicken, and chicken tikka masala

To know: They "spice down" so if you can handle "medium spice" level at other Indian spots - ask for "spicy!

Dine-in: Nicely decorated and very helpful staff - but parking is tricky because it's Lombard St so plan ahead or bus there.
author: Rachel C.

description:
I thought I wasn't going to be able to find delicious, authentic Indian food in the Marina, but boy was I happy I was wrong!

This place is awesome! The dishes are flavorful without being too greasy or too heavy. Try the tikka masala (curry chicken), saag aloo (spinach and potatoes), or baingan bharta (eggplant curry) with a bit of tandoori shrimp and you've got a complete, tasty meal. 

The service is great, too. Say hello to Joseph, Mark, or Nicholas next time you're in there. Tell them John and Cat sent you and they will take good care of you.
author: Kate M.

description: We ordered the chicken cafreal and the fish xacuti. For desert we had the bibinca (?). The fish was great, a bit on the spicy side but that's what we ordered. The chicken cafreal was very very over cooked and chewey. The salted lassi was too thick but the bibinca was very nice.
author: RP K.

description: Great Indian food however they did over charge us as well!! That is why I am sadly giving them three stars, the food was amazing and I would recommend it however I dont enjoy having to have an awkward conversation with the waiter about how he was trying to overcharge us! I'm glad I read yelp reviews prior to going bc I may have over looked the bill ( it was a $10 overcharge)
author: Lauren K.

description:
This was my second time here, first time for the buffet and it was great! The food was amazing across the board.

Mango pudding with pineapple, Goan salad, vegetable samosas, mushroom mattar, vegetable vindaloo.. the list goes on and it was all delicious!

Almost the entire buffet was vegetarian as well, which was nice to see.

I won't hesitate to go back.
author: Jason B.

description:
This is excellent Goan food (basically Indian food with a seafood/coastal twist). I really like most things on the menu, but the main issue here is the location. When Chestnut and Union are only a couple blocks away, it is so difficult to want to go to Lombard. There is something nice about getting out of dinner and walking on a nice street, and Lombard--let's face it, it literally *is* highway 101 (look at a map if you don't believe me). That makes it scary. 

Viva Goa, I hope you move to another street one day so I can bask in your culinary greatness.
author: Mike G.

description:
The best indian buffet in the bay area bar none!
The best 10 dollars you can spend on food in SF in my opinion.
I spent over 3 years in india and consider myself a connisseur, and let me tell you these guys do truly unique regional cuisine of goa which incorporates more seafood and coconut generally....
so good.
author: Jesse S.

description:
Ate here once with my husband since he works close, and have been thinking about it ever since! 

The place offers a wonderful lunch buffet, not a million options, but the point is, what they do have are the RIGHT options.. Everything I really love and they do it all VERY well. 

The service is beyond amazing. They make sure you are pleased with your food and are very kind. I can't wait to go back!
author: Clair C.

description:
This has been my go to spot for Indian food since I moved to the city a year ago.  The food is delicious, and they are good about asking how spicy you want your food...in my case medium is usually safe from here - I can handle spicy food, but eastern foods seem to have a different scale.

I am writing a review today, specifically, because we ordered delivery last night and it took an hour and a half despite them telling me it would only take 45 minutes.  I complained to the manager about it because by the time the food arrived at 8:15 it was way past the time I wanted to eat dinner, as I was planning to going to bed shortly thereafter.  The manager apologized profusely and made it right.  Because of how he handled it I will continue to frequent Viva Goa and recommend it to friends and fellow yelpers.
author: Tony B.

description:
If you've never had Goan food before, PLEASE do yourself a favor and stay clear of stuff you'd normally see on a typical indian menu like the chicken tikka masala and such. Goan restaurants are not all that common and more so rare are good ones!

Goan food is highly fish-centric so I'd suggest the shrimp or fish curries. They have a slight spice to them without being overwhelming or killing the tate of the food. I think they definitely hit the mark on authenticity.

The waiter also was very helpful and explained all the dishes to us (and I'm indian--didnt make me feel like a fool for not knowing).

The loss of the star comes from the decor; a little bland. Something more fun would be nice but I think for a casual lunch or dinner it wont matter.
author: Ash S.

description:
I wish I could say good things about this place but I was left quite disappointed after my first and probably last meal here. I am from Mangalore, which is an Indian city not too far from Goa, and both these places have a LOT of common elements in their cuisines. I was extremely happy to find this place reviewed so highly on Yelp! and convinced my fiance to take me there when I was visiting last weekend. We tried the following dishes from their menu:

Fish cutlets - These were decent; there were 2 big patty portions coated with semolina (rava) which gave them that extra crunch. I wish they served them with some other condiment than plain old tomato ketchup!

Prawn Xacuti with rice - My Goan friend in Chicago made chicken xacuti the other day and it was SOOOO GOOD, I can almost smell and taste the curry in my head!! Unfortunately, Viva Goa's offering was a terrible let down. The xacuti masala didn't seem fresh at all. The dish felt like it was just stored away in the freezer, taken out, reheated and served to us.

Seafood Biryani - The rice grains were well cooked and long. I think the seafood consisted of calamari, scallops and crab meat (or was it fish? I don't remember). This dish was passable but nothing to brag about.

Pork Vindaloo - This one fared the worst! We ordered this after making sure that there were no big pieces of pork fat in the gravy. The gravy looked like something you'd get at a Chinese restaurant - red, soupy, thick. It tasted horrid and I felt like there was tomato ketchup mixed in it. The Goan "vindaloo" is very similar to the Mangalorean "indaad". This dish did not come anywhere close to what I have been eating all this while in India.

Bebinca - My favorite Goan sweet of all times! I had to have this for dessert. What they served us was 4 decent sized pieces. The bebinca was a bit dense but this could probably be because it was not freshly made (the cooking process is quite long and tedious) and was stored in the refrigerator. I still enjoyed the dish!

All in all, this experience was a disappointment! I will have to rely on my friend to satisfy my Goan food cravings until my next trip back home :) Her mum's prawn balchao and mole are A-W-E-S-O-M-E!!!
author: Raquel D.

description: I can't say anything except this place is simply delicious.  We've ordered several times from here (always getting something new) and are never disappointed.  If you like Indian and have never tried Goan cuisine...you have to give this a go.
author: Zoran L.

description: I recommend this place to anyone! Delicious Indian food, and outstanding customer service. I mentioned that I had never tried Indian dessert, and our server brought us some for free. Great place-I'm definitely going back!
author: Jenelle R.

description:
This place is wonderful!
A lot of Goan dishes layered on top of your traditional Indian dishes.
The service is very friendly. One of the owners was there and was helping all the tables choose their dishes. 
We got-
Goan Mussels: interesting mussels on a half shell covered with a red paste. Very flavorful.
Rechardo Pomfret Fish: n entire fish stufed with curry. Very tastey and tranditional Goan cuisine.
Lamb Xacuti: another Goan specialty. Taste similar to lamb curry but the coconut adds a nice layer.
Vegetable Caldin: love the coconut flavor!
Naan
Roti
Bebinca: this apprently takes a long time to make and is usually saved for special occasions. I didn't like it so much :)

All in all you must try this place and go for the traditional Goan dishes.
They also have a lunch buffet where on Sundays they serve goat!
Cannot wait to go back for the buffet on Sundays!!
author: A S.

description:
Great food! Nice ambience. The service is unobtrusive but at the same time attentive. 

My only complaint is that the okra in our veggie dish arrived overcooked. But the accompanying sauce was fantastic! 

We had an onion naan that was hearty and generous with the onions. The skin of the naan had that crisp chewiness to it that all good naans have. 

When they ask you the spice level and you say "mild", it doesn't come spicy at all. I think they err on the side of caution with the levels of spiciness so if you like heat in your food, ask your server to describe their different levels of spiciness.
author: Daniel J.

description: Get the butter chicken and garlic naan -- that's all you really need because it's AMAZING!! Best butter chicken and garlic naan I have ever had! The prices are totally reasonably, the food is incredibly delicious, and the service is attentive, polite, and warm. We went with a group of 7, shared everything family style, and had a delicious meal.
author: Jamie O.

description:
Delicious food, loved it. Without knowing or reading reviews about this restaurant just we ended up here for Lunch buffet, while walking around the city this week. It was worth it. Just 9$ for full meal lunch, perfect. They had Veg as well as non-veg options. I had only vegetarian food. For buffet, they had two Salads, papaya, Mango keer, 3 types of chutney, Samosa and Veg Pakoras, Mushroom-Paneer-Mutter curry, Aloo-Gobi (potato - Cauliflower), Daal, Rice, Channa Masala (Chick peas curry), Naan (Indian flat bread) and Gulab jamun for dessert. 

We would definitely go again to "Viva Goa"
author: Subbu R.

description: Had a couple really good dishes here, pork sorpotel and prawn xacutti. Perfectly cooked proteins (stood up to delivery), with complex curries and sauces. The sweet and sour sauce on the sorpotel was particularly nice, not the standard chinese style cloying sauce, but well balanced and interesting.
author: Derrick V.

description:
A place in the heart of SF in the Marina district....newly opened..you would think they would come up with a new concept.
This place does not fit the Marina style....hole in the wall...poor decor, which has kept it's cost down so that's still ok 
Food....TERRIBLE!!! It's the same generic food that you get in the other cheap indian restaurants that survive just on buffets. 
Fish curry was horrible.....nothing fresh about it. Curry is the same with fish or shrimp or lamb thrown in according to your order. It did not have any freshness. Tomatoes in the curry were likely out of a can....it's california...how hard is it get fresh tomatoes and spices?????
1 star is for the customer service....everyone was very nice!
For a city known for the best foods in the world ...this definitely is not even close to the other new restaurants coming up here!!
author: Justyna R.

description:
Being a mangalorean christian I LOVED THIS PLACE. We were worried after reading the reviews and thought we should try the buffet to be safe. The fish curry(mild spice) was spot on and so was goat curry and chicken tandoori (perfect), we are not found of spicy food that kills your taste buds, but tasty flavourful food and Viva Goa delivered. Looking at the menu I could not resist but order Pork Sorpotel(traditional goan/mangalorean pork dish - not for the faint of heart it has pig intestive, tongue, heart, stomach and meat) and fell in love with it (this dish is meant to be eaten the next day) so I got the left overs to go and enjoyed it the next day and the day after.

NOTE: Good Indian food is not traditionally spicy.
author: Charel L.

description: The best chicken 65 I ever had in USA. It's been so long that I got the taste of food which was a lot more similar to the food in India. I can say that this is the best authentic indian restaurant. I strongly recommend to all of u guys. The service is super fast and great.
author: Jennifer K.

description:
I'm really glad there is good Indian food in the neighborhood.  Love the samoas, naan, and chicken tikki masala.

I thought the service was great too. 

Can't wait for my next trip to try additional items.  I'll have to try out delivery too.
author: Shelly W.

description:
I've eaten at a lot of Indian restaurants in the Bay Area and I have now found my spot.  Viva Goa is a great little restaurant that has some of the best Indian food around.  Quality food and exceptional service are hard to find but this place delivers.  
I do feel that they are understaffed as the food can take a while but I am never complaining once it arrives.  
I used to go to Tandoori Mahal all the time, but I won't go back there now that I have found this great restaurant.  
My girlfriend and I always get the Chicken Tikka Masal and Chana Masala with rice and garlic naan.  With Chai tea, the bill comes out to about $35.  More reasonable than Tandoori Mahal.  
Viva Goa!
author: Devin C.

description:
Really good Indian food on Lombard St/ Downtown SF. 
Authentic taste! 
Just wish their servers could smile a bit more! :) 
They generally came across as cold and serious. 
But we had a superb meal after a couple of food tragedies in nearby Indian restaurants..
author: Shishir S.

description:
There are no cheap foods in the Marina.  But you can find great value!  

Viva Goa is one block from my shop.  Their bright and colorful sidewalk sign is what got me to give them a try.  I've been here about four times.  $8.99 for all you can eat Indian buffet lunch in the Marina is too tough to pass up.  

The buffet is pretty standard. Unlimited fresh and hot nan is served.  Traditional dishes such as butter chicken, chicken masala, tandoori chicken, curry vegetables and curry fish is served alongside basmati rice, samosa, fresh salad, chutney, and desserts such as bread soaked in syrup and rice pudding.  The food is delicious.  Everything tastes fresh even though it is buffet-style.  The staff is friendly.  The price is right.  I enjoy dining here.
author: Gloria Y.

description:
A decent indian place near my house! Yes!

The service was friendly and attentive, although the latter may have been helped by the place being half empty. The food was also good. We had the chicken biryani, the fish masala and the garlic naan. The chicken biryani was pretty good (the portion was large enough that we took home half of it as leftovers). The fish masala was tasty and went quite well with the garlic naan and some rice.

I'll have to try out more of the menu later.
author: Jeff L.

description:
OK so i already wrote a 5 star review, but i am writing an update to really get my point across:  THIS FOOD IS DELICIOUS!  On average I get dinner delivered from Viva Goa once every week and a half or so.  Before discovering Viva Goa, Indian food did not happen for me very often, as there is a serious shortage of decent indian spots in this part of town.  Needless to say, I have turned into a one-woman PR machine for this place, telling everyone who will listen to go there because i want to make sure they stay in business to feed my addiction.

Admittedly, my experience with the menu is limited because I am having a hard time branching away from the Chicken Tikka Masala because it is amazing!  (and just spicy enough to make me sweat a little when prepared "medium").  But why fix it if it aint broken, right?  I recently traded in the vegetable biryani for the Aloo Gobhi in an attempt to cut down on the rice (although potato and cauliflower instead is not much of a carb cut).  The Aloo Gobhi- although i am sure I am pronouncing it wrong, is a great addition to my dinner routine.  I highly reccomend the food at Viva Goa, and the people are awesome as well.
author: Kari P.

description: I like chicken xacuti, vindaloo. Malai/paneer kofta is delicious but paneer makhni is ok ok. Breads are fresh.  The staff is attentive but little slow.
author: Astha S.

description:
They have a lunch buffet for $8.99 and it was pretty crowded on a Saturday afternoon. They had about 5-6 main courses, rice, salad and samosas to pick from. They also had several dipping sauces including raita. The food was good, but not stellar. 

Service was great and we got our naan refilled very quickly.
author: Natalie S.

description: My favorite Indian restaurant not just in San Francisco, but Bay Area! I've been looking for a great Butter Chicken ever since Nawab closed in San Mateo. This was even better. I was impressed with quality of food in all other dishes as well. Well balanced flavor with hint of spice. Major Yammmm!!!
author: alex c.

description:
Pretty solid, standard Indian food. I wasn't terribly impressed, but for the price, it was good. They had a relatively quick delivery. I noticed quite a bit of grease on top of each dish - something to be expected amongst lower quality Indian food, but still, I dislike it. 

I have a bunch of friends who go here regularly. I've never actually been inside, so I can't speak of the interior. Their food is good enough for me to have them as my first call for relatively cheap Indian. If I want something a bit better, I'll go to Helman's Palace on Van Ness.
author: Nick B.

description: Fantastic Indian food, great service, totally fair price. Try the Samosas and Pakoras. Simply delicious !
author: Yaniv D.

description:
Not your traditional north indian restaurant.  Be adventurous and try the traditional "goa" dishes - indicated on the menu by a green palm tree to the left of the item.  We have tried their chicken xacuti, fish masala fry and the vegetable caldin - all were excellent - we also tried a dessert called bebinca which is like a bread pudding - worth the try.  Wait staff is excellent and pay attention.  It is kid friendly.  Can't wait to try more dishes next time.
You may be tempted to travel to Goa after eating here - check it out - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goa
Beautiful architecture, history, beaches, culture and food.
author: Ketan D.

description: Good food, friendly service.  I recommend the Goan Lamb Masala and Chicken Lollipops.
author: Andrew B.

description:
My first experience with Goan cuisine and I must say I quite liked it.
We went early on a recent evening and it was quite empty inside(shame really). The owners were very friendly and helpful.
We selected a really nice Pinot Noir which went well with the food.
Dishes :Bengan Bertha ( baked mashed eggplant ) and one order of Roti
One of my favorite dishes.
Fish Curry was equally delicious.
Chicken Xacuti and Lamb Vindaloo came in second.
I usually don't eat rice but theirs is very nice with shredded carrots and peas.
I was quite full but my friends were up to dessert.
Gulab Jamun:milk balls w.syrup
Bebinca: flour and milk cakes
I did not try them but they disappeared and my friends liked them.
Ice cream was home made pistachio and mango , very decent.

I really recommend this place for an inexpensive, great Indian-Goan
dining experience. Hope many more people will discover it.
I will be back to try some more vegetarian dishes.
author: Maria C.

description:
I really loved the Goan style food here.  The Ambot Tik was the best seafood dish I've ever had in an Indian restaurant.  They use a white fish that our waiter said was solefish (sp?).  Whatever it was, it was delicious.

The okra was great too.  If you say spicy they will really bring the spice.  

My only warnings are do not order wine by the glass or the green salad.  The malbec had not been stored properly and was on the edge of going bad, and the salad was bleh.  But it's an indian restaurant, so I'm rating them on their indian food which is five star.  

Great service as well.  Highly recommended!
author: Carlton W.

description: My favorite Indian restaurant in the city! Although technically Goan-their Chicken Tikka Masala is the best. I try one dish with the Masala each time I go and so far I haven't found another to rave as high about (although reading other ratings about Sag paneer and samosas- I will need to order those next time). Either way I enjoy this place and it is my go-to when I'm in the mood for Indian!
author: Jenny L.

description:
Probably the BEST place for Goan food, just amazing. The story of how I discovered this place was, of course, Yelp. Took my guardians there because I felt like eating Indian, but Goan was close enough, so we drove there, sat down with good service, and went out as happy people.

Food was amazing; couldn't come out happier. I had the Chicken Biryani, my guardians had the Chicken Tikka Masala and I forgot what the other had, but some really nice lamb/meat that looked like meatballs, but of course weren't meatballs. The Biryani was a mountain for me, huge amounts of rice and it was just wonderful, we shared each other's food and the curry was beautifully thick and creamy with the right amount of spices, and the lamb/meat was spiced and cooked extremely well.

The service is good; caring people, I suppose. Asked if the food is good and how everything is, just like any waiter would. Nothing bad about them, just good people.

The place is not bad, only been there twice and every time we get there there's always a place for us to sit at, just the three of us. It's not a place were it gets deserted all the time, people pile up as time goes by, and the good thing about it is that a reservation doesn't seem to be necessary... hopefully I'm right but we've never called for a reservation and we've always had spots open for us.

Overall: I would come back here anytime, and take my friends along if they were foodies like me. If you can't finish the food, the best thing to do is take it home, and I mean it. Like what the waiter said to us, "Here is you late night snack!" He just read my mind.
author: Bryan S.

description:
I as lucky enough to get a Bloomspot deal for this place.  I've only been there once, this last Saturday, arriving 30 minutes before closing.

I will be back for sure.  This place hit all the bases: excellent food, fast and friendly service, a good overall value, very clean, surprisingly good music, a simple yet effective wine menu...

See you again soon Viva Goa!
author: D N.

description:
Great food. Great friendly service. Low prices.

Their tikka massala is awesome. The chicken lollipops are also the bomb.

Every Indian restaurant should be like this. Also, the guys are incredibly friendly.

I'm always craving to go back!
author: Jose S.

description: I went to Viva Goa for the lunch buffet, and I was not disappointed! Had an array of popular Indian dishes (even though it was close to closing) and we were in and out of there in about 30 minutes. They were not pushy or frustrated that we showed up a half hour to close. The rice pudding and spinach cream sauce was delicious. My husband was a fan of a fish dish that we hadn't seen at Indian restaurants before. Although they didn't have naan available at the buffet, we simply asked for some, and they happily made some for us - free of charge. Maybe it is usually available at the buffet but we got there too late?! Anyway, it was garlic flavored and yummy. Looking forward to returning for a quick and inexpensive lunch.
author: Kelsey K.

description: The hidden jewel of the Marina! Fantastic authentic Indian food with a relaxing romantic atmosphere.  This is a great first date or have a great convo with your friends kind of place!  I always get the tandori fish, naan, amazing rice, vegetable samosas, and a mango lassi.  The chicken tiki masala is great too.  It has a relaxing Goan atmosphere and all the waiters are top notch!  It's a great restaurant and they deliver quickly if you're in the area.  This is my go to place when my parents come in town too.  Want good food, authentic conversation, and a relaxing atmosphere, this has the essence of that perfect combo.
author: Janet G.

description:
Epic Yelp Rating FAIL. Quick Tip: There's an IHOP down the block. It'll be better, trust me. 

- Thin Lassi
- Watery Lentil Soup
- Flavorless Chicken Dish
author: Janett R.

description: This is my first experience with Goan cuisine but I can guarantee I'm goan back! Great food, helpful service, and good prices! The waiter recommended the Vegetable Caldin and I found the spices really delicious.
author: Stephen S.

description: Because it is on Lombard street and not Chestnut street, it is not crowded.  Don't let the fact it's not full dissuade you.  The food is as good as I've ever had.  Everything we had was great.  Try it you'll like it.
author: Jeffrey P.

description:
Ordered samosas for starters. Bland, saltless potato returned. Then, I ordered okra masala. It was raw at first. When I asked for a refry, it came back sweet.

None of my non-veg eating friends were happy with their dishes as well.
author: Connoisseur D.

description:
So me and my 3 friends were starving after spending the day at the Bluegrass Festival in Golden Gate Park, we decided on Indian food so I checked YELP for some suggestions and decided to Viva Goa.

We got there at 7:30 and were not served our food until about 8:45-9:00. Unbelievable that it took sooo long to deliver a table of 4, 5 entrees. We even had to ask for our drinks after ordering them 20 minutes prior. 

The food was delicious (only reason the got a 2nd star) but it really didn't make up for how long we had to wait. We were then handed the check and not even offered dessert. We felt the wait staff could have been a lot more courteous to let us know about the wait and to provide us a refill of the the lentil wafer or something, but they just let us sit there and starve.
author: Christine D.

description:
This place is legit!  Have ordered delivery here 4 times in the past 7 days! Its that good. Authentic Goan (Former Portuguese colony in India) food. Great service and no minimum delivery charge! They in fact delivered just 1 chicken dish to me yesterday and they never whine about it. 
The food is fresh and tasty. So far tried the Pomfret, Xacuti, Cafreal, Vege Caldin. All were authentic Goan. Will try out the buffet and dine in soon.
author: Karthick S.

description: Christian & I had a nice lunch-one of our favorite places here in Marina District, definitely our favorite Indian Restaurant here in SF! Love their Lunch Buffet-great variety, complimentary Naan Bread and delicious food! Especially their Goa Fish We love their Chicken Tikka Masala, Mushroom    Paneer Masala and Variety of Naan Breads at Dinner too! Always Provide Wonderful Service! Feel Right at home! Thanks!
author: Christina H.

description: Yes, still love it. The vegetable pakoras are addicting.  I'm being picky, but we always note to call the cell because our building buzzer is broken. And every time, they try to ring the building. Fortunately we are near the door so we can hear it. We even bet if they'll call or try to buzz. It's losing it's fun because they always buzz :-).
author: Brie P.

description:
I normally don't go to the Marina district, but my housemate and I were feeling a bit adventurous today and decided to drive out there. So I took out my new phone and typed in Indian food on Yelp and this was one of the first places to come up  on the list.

So we ordered the Goan Chicken Masala and the Chicken Tikka Masala with some rice and it was simply amazing. The taste on both of these dishes were out of this world, especially the Chicken Tikka Masala. This particular dish is the one I always get at Indian restaurants as a comparison piece to see how it stacks up to the competition. And let's just say this was one of the best ones I've ever had. I can't wait to go back again and try some of their other specialty dishes.

Let's go go goa, to Viva Goa!!!
author: Gajan K.

description: Food tastes good and arrives as quoted. Love the paneer tikka masala... I know it's not traditional Goan, but it tastes good. Would recommend.
author: Amy L.

description: Tried this place out based on the Yelp reviews and looking for something "different". So worth it. Lunch buffet is a steal at $8.99! A moderate assortment of dishes but all of it was delicious. Service was great! My wife and I compared it to the popular Amber India's buffet where there might be a greater selection but the food here was just as good if not better.
author: Eric C.

description:
Very good!!

I saw the place as i drove by on Lombard. We used to vacation in Goa as children so I took my wife there as a Stewart's date night.  I had the mulgatawni soup it was very very good warming, delicious. For my entree i had the pork vindaloo with rice. This was also very good with lots of flavor of sweetness, cardamon and cloves very southern Indian. I tried also the salted lassi which was a drink I had not tasted since living in India as a punka walla. Then my wife had the sizzling chicken tika with a massala sauce on the side. It was spiced subtlety and dryer then the normal gee coated rubbish other "authentic" places serve. We had the mango kulfi and bebinca for desert. The bebinca takes forever to make so there is no Indian restaurant that I know of that has it on the menu. It is really delicious with lots of coconut and sugar as i remember it as a child.

They have a buffet during the day that changes every day. I cant wait to try these delights!!
author: Andrew S.

description: The lunch buffet is great value for money. The food was yummy and probably the best indian food I have has in the SF.
author: Ryan M.

description: Awesome food. Awesome service. People are very friendly. The fish curry was yummy with the light coconut sauce. The buffet was a normal menu but everything tasted good.
author: Kruthika R.

description: I come during the lunch buffet hours & always enjoy the food. They have plenty of choices & the best nan to accompany their dishes! Staff is always friendly. Very reasonable price for such a yummy lunch buffet. This is a great hidden treasure of delicious Indian food!!
author: Sfgal S.

description:
Yum yum! Viva Goa had been on our list for a while so I was very excited to finally try Goan food here!

I quite enjoyed the large crispy chip that we were given. It is served with two sauces, one green and one red. The red sauce is sort of fruity and interesting but I much preferred the green, spicy one. 

We asked our server for an appetizer recommendation. He suggested either the chicken lollipops or the shrimp. We decided to get the shrimp because I was a little wary of the "Szechuan sauce" that the chicken lollipops are served with. Sounds really cute though, I mean, lollipops? Maybe next time. The shrimp was good. They're hot, not cold.

For our entrees, we got the Fish Curry and the Lamb Xacuti. Also an order of rice and an order of naan. Loved the fish curry! Medium is the perfect amount of spicy and the curry complemented the fish very well. My favorite thing about the fish (aside from the wonderful taste) was the heat retention in the center of each piece of fish. Mmm...

The lamb xacuti was good as well! The lamb is cooked well and the sauce is not too overwhelming with lamb flavor. Just right. I really enjoyed the two dishes that we got because they were quite different and gave us a great dining experience. 

Glad that Viva Goa did not disappoint and I definitely want to come back to try more items on the menu!
author: Lydia W.

description:
Very impressive! I was hesitant when i first entered, since the outside of the place, and actually even the inside were very simple. But this rating is based entirely on the food not the appearance.

I wish i could remember the name of the dishes that we had, but one that i could remember was Chicken 65, this was just amazing! Enough said.
The other dish that I couldn't believe was even better than the Chicken 65 was this beef with potatoes spices and CINNAMON! Yes that is right cinnamon, and not just a hint of cinnamon like i expected, but rather enough that you can taste and smell it within the bounty of other flavors that explode all over your tongue as you take your first bite. Oh also this place does not mess around with the level of spicy. If you ask for spicy you get spicy! I mentioned to the server, "Extra spicy" since i'm used to being at places that laugh at you when you ask for spicy food (Often rightfully so). Well i can say... this was one spicy dish, but not too spicy that it wasn't pure deliciousness.

I am happy to add to the many 5 star reviews of this place. Our entire meal was less than $30 for 2 people with one large beer (enough for 2), and it was one of the best dining experiences i have had in the Marina.

The ONLY negative feedback that i have is that it took a while for the check to come once our meal was complete, and when it did arrive i was in the restroom. This almost allowed my date to pay for the meal!
Aside from this slight error, Bravo Viva Goa!
author: Brian K.

description:
Let's be clear - the Marina does not do Indian.  And depending where you are on the learning curve, it arguably does not have anything *really* great.  As with the clientele, lots of restaurants are good (yes, that includes Mamacitas), reasonably healthy, fair-to-over-priced.

That said, I lived in the Marina for 5 years craving easy Indian.  My laziest alternative was in Pac Heights and mediocre at best.  When Viva Goa moved into the old Tibetan spot on Lombard, I was not expecting much - but I could smell their concoctions percolating through the neighborhood.

Because of my earlier-stated laziness, I checked out Yelp and saw positive reviews in the first week despite the awkward location.  Knowing nothing about Goan food, I decided to check it out and was amazed how accurate the reviews were - great flavor, even tender fish curry.  I NEVER eat fish in the buffets, much less in curry.  Overall the buffet is reasonably small, but very well rounded with the requisite chicken dishes, some good veggie and always something interesting like fish, lamb or goat.  Yeah baby - goat!

To wrap up, these guys do a great job for Marina and Pac Heights.  Good flavors and some sort of Goan influence, that I hear is unique.  Besides being tasty and cheap - the most important thing is these guys are super nice and hospitable.  Go get your fix and blow off the Grove or the Shitty Pig.
author: DaPlayer A.

description: I was excited based on the reviews. The chicken saag was so-so. Chicken  was on the slimy side. I request mild and it was medium. All in all it was fine. Nice service. And the menu had some different options from the norm. So I'll go back to try the buffet or one of those unique dishes, but I won't rush...
author: Andrew K.

description: The buffet was delicious and spicy, the naan was really good, excellent samosa, and they even had goose berry pickle.  This is how an Indian buffet should be like and taste.
author: Liji J.

description:
Nice place. Reasonable prices and very nice wait staff. Free parking on street in front kn evening. 

Food is generally good but somewhat bland. Had high hopes but a tad disappointed. I eat in many indian restaurants and have even had Goan food from a Goan acquaintance. 

Best was chai tea (with refills!), fish curry, basmati rice. Avoid Mulgatawni soup (most bland I have ever eaten - no Indian spice at all) and aloo paratha ( dry and hard). 

I wish they would improve because I really wanted to give them the highest rating.
author: G M.

description:
I went the 4th day it opened and placed an order for the chicken lollypop. It was really good! Pretty much everything I've had here since (chicken 65,fish curry..) has been nothing short of excellent.
Food A+
Service A+
author: Sunil P.

description:
Used to order fairly regularly through Seamless, never had a problem.  Then over the past several months, we've experienced worse & worse service.  Twice now they've "never received" orders from us through Seamless despite receiving a confirmation email, & several times they have "got the wrong number" when sending food, despite nothing in my records having changed.

This time around, we called after an hour (estimated had said 30-45 minutes) to check on the status of our order.  We were assured it was "on its way" and would "be there shortly".  Another 40 minutes went by, & still no food - finally we called back, only to have my name & number asked over and over (literally 5 times in a row).  They couldn't seem to even remember my name in the 10-15 seconds between asking it.  Finally they informed me that no order had ever been received - despite the fact that they had assured us 40 minutes prior that it was "on its way".  When I pointed this out, the man on the phone told me to "shut up" & "take it up with Seamless", at which point he promptly hung up.

Anyway, if you want to be disrespected & forgotten, this place is likely to deliver.  If you want it to *actually* deliver real food, you'd best try someplace else.
author: Steve F.

description: Feel in love with this place when i first got it for take out. Now I take all my friends and we're all in love. Great traditional Indian food that is priced really well. If i had a go to, I'd get the Butter Chicken! Its amazing!
author: Scott P.

description:
Sandy M and I went here to try out some Indian masala goodness. But we were swayed by the big Daily Lunch Buffet sign out of the doorway...dang...$8.99....sigh...such a buffet whore.

First thing we tried was the chicken tandoori (I know that it's got to be more tender and juicy right out of the kitchen instead of sitting on burner for hours), which turned out to be too dry. The vegetable samosas were filled with carrots and potatoes...I liked it even better with their mango chutney sauce poured all over (I'm all about the sweet and savory). The naan was excellent. Very hot and crispy, almost like a cracker! The Goan Chicken Masala had excellent flavors and the chicken was really tender. 
The Goan Goat Masala had a gamey flavor but then most goat dishes do.

My favorite is the vegetarian dish Channa Masala (Garbanzo cooked with onion, tomato, fresh herbs & spices)..all Sandy said was, "it has peas and tofu in it. How good could it be?"  Hello? It was hella good...the sauce with naan made it wayyy worth the trip back again for seconds.

For dessert, we grabbed the sweet cantaloupes, and I had the rice pudding which had real rice in it...I was thinking of the creamy milk based mushy type but the rice actually was cooked and sitting in minty herbal flavorings...slightly sweet.  I tried the Gulab Jamun (milky fried balls soaked in flavored syrup), they were not as sweet as I thought and really delicious.

If you're here, definitely get an order of Mango Lassi. Both Sandy M and I agree Viva made the best one we've ever had...so thick with mangos and chilled perfectly.

I think I'll come back here next time and do a la carte. That way I can defintely get the taste of flavors fresh from their kitchens.
author: Pauline L.

description: Love this place!  Have visited twice so far.  Enjoyed their chicken saag and Nan with fruit and nuts.  Service is excellent and very generous with special offerings.
author: Debra M.

description:
I didn't know anything about Goan cuisine before Viva Goa.  Nicholas the owner told me all about it; his is Indian food with Portuguese influence.  I've only been for the lunch buffet so far and highly recommend that you try everything, especially the Goan dishes (vegetable caldin with coconut milk, the fish dishes.)  

Go.  Trust me, you'll love it.
author: Michelle P.

description: Great food. Must try the Sungatts (Prawns), Fish Ambot Tik and Chicken Xacuti. Ambience is a bittoo dark for my liking. We had strange people in the restaurant the other day, a couple of ladies trying to hurl comments at us in broken hindi and abusing themselves with choicest words. Management didnt throw them out. I am cutting 2 stars, one for ambience, 1 for not throwing out unruly people
author: Sushant T.

description: This place certainly doesn't deserve the 4 stars that it has. We were here for lunch today, the mussels were really bad- fishy and rubbery, all signs that the fish wasn't fresh. We also ordered a tandoori fish and fried pompfret, both of which were below average. The staff was courteous and took the mussels off the check. This is a nice gesture but doesn't do it for me to come back for the food. The 2 stars is only for the staff.
author: Ashwini S.

description:
We just returned home after having a wonderful meal at Viva Goa.  We were a party of six and rather than share a dish, each of us ordered separately.  Because of the reviews, we did order only the Goan items - Chicken Vindaloo, Prawn Xacutti; Goan Chicken Masala and Goan Special Mix Platter.  In addition, we ordered Vegetable Pakoras and Baigan Bertha to share.  Without fail, each person loved his/her dish and the Pakoras and Baigan were special.  We did order the Bebinca and were not terribly impressed but that is a matter of taste, I expect.  The Kulfi (ice cream) would probably have been a better choice.  

The service was excellent and the staff answered all questions and helped with our choices.  The beer drinkers tried two different Indian beers and preferred the Taj.  We will definitely be back!
author: Sue B.

description: Delicious food; great, friendly service; clean; and affordable! They graciously accommodate vegans, even when the buffet didn't have as many vegan choices. We'll definitely be going back. They deliver, too!
author: D. B.

description: Amazing buffet and service! Really nice people here and the buffet lunch is great :) get the chicken masala and you will be in heaven ... If you like Indian cuisine! Definitely coming back :)
author: Joseph P.

description:
Let me start off by saying "Free Delivery" with no minimum order! This is key on a rainy, cold night when the last thing you want to do is cook OR go out for dinner.

I ordered the chicken tikka masala (hot) with some lovely jasmine rice. The portions were large and plenty left-over for another meal. The tikka masala was perfectly spiced and have definitely ordered from them a few more times since writing this review...and no disappointments.
author: Dianna S.

description:
celebrated my birthday on the 11th of November here.

This place has a chef who has come from india and provides you with an authentic taste of goan food.

The goan food has portugeese heritage and this was evident with the dishes we ordered.

ordered the :
Lamb Xacuti - good.
Fish / Shrimp / Scallop Masala - good


As it was my birthday I got a complimentary orange kulfi .
They had real orange peels which had the orange kulfi.
It was amazing and it tasted like real oranges, literally.

Thanks Gurpreet, Francis and Mikhail for the bday treat.
author: Utsav M.

description: Lunch buffets usually aren't too great but this place rocks - excellent, well priced buffet with fresh fish, not fried or battered in anyway... Look forward to eating here again.
author: Mike S.

description:
Good food,fast & friendly service. I tried tandoori fish and fish curry. The food was good, but the curry had obviously been tailored to suit a larger international audience. The fish tasted fresh - not smelly etc. 
The menu doesn't seem to have too many 'Goan' dishes besides the curry, Xacuti, Vindaloo, and Bebinca. The vegetarian section had mostly standard menu items one would find in any other Indian restaurant. Overall, it didn't live up to the hype of being a "Goan food" restaurant, for someone like me who's been exposed to Goan food growing up....but it's a good place to start if you've never tried any Goan food.
author: Shweta V.

description: Went here for dinner club with my friends- this place is great! There were 8 of us so we got to try a ton of different things. The chicken tandori was awesome and comes piping hot on sizzling plate. The Saag Aloo was pretty yummm too. I thought the butter chicken was a little different- very red rich thick sauce....and small peices of chicken. Naan is awesome and perfect size. I'd go again!
author: Ricquel N.

description:
this place is amazing, its very rare to find Goan food in the City. 
Great Chicken Lollipops, Beef Cutlets , Lamb Xacuti.

NOTE : Dont go there and have the Typical indian food and expect it to be great. THIS is a GOAN food restraunt, please try out those special dishes.

If you want to get more experimental ask the chef what he has in the kitchen.. they generally have dishes they dont put up on their menu and are deilicious.
author: Neil D.

description: Hands down best Goa Indian food ever!!! The staff is super friendly and attentive! Get the fish curry (sweet and sour)!!!
author: Alex L.

description:
I live in the Curry section of Murray Hill, and this spot certainly measures up.

Great lunch buffet with wide selection, attentive service, and low prices. Can't comment on authenticity as I am not very familiar with Goan cuisine, and the regular offerings seemed pretty pedestrian.

Off menu sarapatel sp? is delcious btw.
author: Christian L.

description: A Portuguese/Goan restaurant on the weird end of marina. I love the staff here. They are always warm and humorous. The food is consistently delicious and my wife and I try something new every time we come in.
author: Pete F.

description:
My husband and I had been looking for a Goan/Konkani restaurant in Bay area for a long time. Then a friend took us to this place for dinner last weekend.. Very good food. Reminded me of food on my Goa trip 5-6 years back..

We had chicken xacuti, stuffed charred pomfret (with stuffing called Rashida), fish cutlet and a lamb preparation.. It was all spicy (they did ask for our preference on extent of spiciness) and delicious. Macaroni lentil soup was superb. Good prices, portions, service and taste.

At the end we were also offered a complimentary dessert - orange ice-cream - which was actual orange pieces stuffed with ice-cream - quite innovative.

Must try to get a real taste of Goan food!
author: Mamta B.

description: They have a great lunch buffet. Great food and good variety. very friendly service too. That first taste of hot nan is amazing! Their chicken tikka is delish! I like the fish dish they have too. I'm glad they are right around the corner from our house.
author: Jade C.

description:
Lovely ambiance. Very simple, yet not underdone. Plenty of seating space, and a very friendly staff. 
If you cant handle spices, I'd recommend going mild, rather than medium. Medium was a bit hot for a few of my friends. 
The appetizers were delectable. Just the right amount of spices in which the food was cooked. As a main course, the lamb was amazing. I havent had such tender lamb in the US before, it basically melted in your mouth. The chicken xacuti was lovely. It had a very different flavor to it, and not in a bad way at all! 

Overall, I'd definitely recommend this place.
author: Gurpreet S.

description:
As you can tell from most of the reviews on here, Viva Goa is a hit! While several Indian restaurants claim to serve dishes from Goa, including the ubiquitous Vindalho/Vindaloo, they are never able to represent the uniqueness of the cuisine from this part of the world. Because Viva Goa specializes in Goan cuisine and is run by Goans, the menu has several authentic dishes, including Chicken Cafreal, Sorpotel, and more.

Not only is the food very tasty, the service is attentive, and the restaurant setting is pleasant. 

As this is a new establishment, perhaps in time the owners might concentrate on the decor inside; the Konkanni music playing in the background is a nice touch, though. I wish the owners much success as it is very well deserved!
author: noit e.

description:
I accidentally came across this restaurant while driving by.  It was a delight to find a restaurant that serves Goan cuisine and it surpassed my expectations.  I loved the authentic Goan food, which is rarity in the US.  Goan cuisine is a unique Indian cuisine influenced by its Indian origins infused with over four hundred years of Portuguese colonialism and cookery. I  strongly recommend ordering the Goan dishes from the à la carte menu.

The service was excellent which made a great dining experience and I strongly recommend it.
author: Sandman D.

description:
Viva Goa is taaasty. The vindaloo was amazing, some fish cakes we had as a starter also stood out. Friendly service and also they don't charge enough. 

We had to travel across town to get here, but we'll be back!
author: j r.

description:
I really am Meh about this place. The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. Normally that would merit a rice even 3 stars. While I distrust any food that comes to the table too fast after ordering, I also hold some reservations on food that takes too long, especially when it's not particularly busy.

We came here after work for dinner one night when I was upset that I had missed curry up now for lunch, and was craving some spice like no other. I had chosen the place because we had eaten some amazing paneer tandoori in Vancouver and had been searching for another restaurant that served it. Viva Goa was the first one we found, and I sort of wish we hadn't, the tandoori was beyond dry and tasteless.

There's also something to be said about conscientious waiters, if when the two of us order two rices, and you don't mention that one order of rice is generally portioned for 3 people, it's irritating. Not because I wasted a 1.99 on rice, but because it went straight into the trash untouched.

Anyway, when it was all said in done, dinner took way too long, the food was dry and salty. Not horrible, but not particularly remarkable. I'd say it's worth a try, the bench seats are cute. but avoid the bathroom if you get claustrophobic.
author: Allyson S.

description: Great buffet! Was looking for a quick, warm meal in the marina area and found this place. Great service and the food was fantastic. Everything dish was delicious.
author: Allison C.

description:
The Chicken Tikka Masala is amazing!  I've gotten tired of the usuals (Rotee and Spicy Bite) with their inconsistencies and Viva Goa is 2 for 2.  Really interesting dishes and I can't get enough of these Indian spiced dishes.   Big bonus they delivered to my house but I've ordered early each time since I know it's slightly far.  Here's to hoping they keep on delivering to me because it's D-LISH-ASS and TAST-AY.

Recommended!
author: annie s.

description:
Goan food or rather lack thereof has been the only hole in the cuisine available in the Bay Area.  So I've been salivating to go try this place.

I'll say that I'm glad they made the attempt but the flavors fall short to authentic.   The three things which were pretty good were the sorpotel which the server offered me though it wasn't on the menu, the veggie caldin, and the chicken cafreal.    The vindaloo was ok - mostly chili, not the traditional flavor - it felt like they'd used rechado masala to make vindaloo.   I was most disappointed with the fish curry - it bears no resemblance at all to Goan fish curry.   I was also very disappointed that they had no bebinca available, the kulfi we had instead was ok.

So overall - the food is tasty and the service friendly, but it's not something that would make a Goan feel like home.
author: S C.

description: I have been to this place only once.. Love the ambience..warm and welcoming waiters.. Tried Soropotel(Goan delicacy) it was mind blowing.. Also had the home made pista kulfi for dessert which was very good
author: Net T.

description:
We were looking for an Indian near the Marina and this hit the spot! The music inside was terrible, the service was quiet but attentive and the food was great!

We enjoyed Poppadoms, tandoori mixed platter, rice and a roti! $42 and we were full!
author: Jake S.

description: Great atmosphere, large tables if you  like a  lot of room like me.  Food less spicy that most indian food,  Goan style .   service excellent.
author: Dan P.

description:
Went here for lunch.  Actually, I wasn't planning on it but saw the sign out front saying something to the fact of an Indian lunch buffet for $10 so decided why not.  I didn't even bother checking Yelp first.  Had I, that would have cinched the deal.

Great buffet-- got there early (around 11:30) so there was only one other table.  Lots of choices... very flavorful. I'm normally not a big buffet fan (usually prefer ordering off the menu) but this place won me over.

If you are in the area and like Indian food, it's worth a try.  Easy metered parking out front-- just make sure you have your stash of quarters handy.
author: Brian M.

description: I was super excited to find a Goan restaurant in the US, but the place underwhelmed me. I wasn't expecting authentic food and the food met my expectations. Sorpatel and pomfret were pretty decent. What turned me and my friends off was the service. The waiters were downright rude to us, making snide comments, no smile on their faces..nothing. We had to keep signaling them to come to our table to take our order. One of the waiters, Sam, was great though..
author: Ro D.

description:
I was craving something spicy and found this gem on Yelp near my BF's place so we headed out and a quick walk down the street lead us right into Viva Goa.

++ For the fact that they do free delivery, but since the house had a dinner party going on we decided to go to the restaurant instead. I loved the food. We had the Chicken Xacuti and Lamb Masala with some garlic naan. It was so good ~ even with my tummy trying to fight the spice I kept eating.

Even writing this review makes me hungry. Marina/Cow-Hollow - it can be hard to find some place that has great prices and good and Viva Goa seems to combine them all. It was quiet and much like the last reviewer, I really liked that it was quiet, but the staff was very nice and the food was really yummy so they deserved to be Yelp'd.
author: rei a.

description:
This is a review for vegetarian food!

We went there today for lunch. Good service, but the food took a little long to show up. But the 8.95 buffet looked great for vegetariand (4 dishes plus dessrt, salad etc and rotis/rice and some meat dishes-wow)

The wraps were good, needed some more spice and these were really huge. 

The veggie platter with paneer was a lot of broccoli and cauliflower...really ok. 

The veg biryani was good, the veg caldim gravy was good...but i expected it to have more gravy in it.

They had Kingfisher beer to go with the papadums and chutneys-awesome! Overall good stuff, but I hope they spice things up! Glad that theres a Goan restaurant here!
author: Soniya R.

description: the food here is just awsome ,you should try the goan food here and the serviced and the atmosphere here is just wonderful.it is great to go out for a family too.it is a must to try out this place when your are in  San Francisco
author: Pelcy B.

description: Came here for the lunch buffet. Not bad if you don't like spicy indian food.  I would have preferred to have more spices in some of the curry dishes.  Their garlic nann were really good though! Hot and garlicky!!!  It was a bit warm in the restaurant though, not really sure if they turned on the A/C.
author: Tiffany H.

description: I am an Indian food fanatic and I love this place. Also, they have a nice, quiet restaurant - for those of us who like to hear conversation at the table. And they deliver!
author: Brianna M.

description: My boyfriend and I LOVE Indian food. When we first moved to the area about a month ago, we had some delivery Indian that really disappointed. Not to be discouraged from ordering in our favorite cuisine, we decided to try Viva Goa after passing by. We ordered in and the delivery came pretty fast. It was also inexpensive! The garlic Naan was OK, which could have been because it was delivered instead of eaten fresh out of the oven. The food we had was beyond delicious and we will gladly go back again. I can't wait to go back and check out the lunch buffet! This is now our go-to neighborhood Indian place!
author: Holly G.

description:
First goan place in the city (maybe even in the bay area). We (4 of us) were  really excited. Here is what we ordered & what I thought 

Malabari Jinga :  too ketchupy. expected smaller shrimp since they used jinga in the name. however were larger shrimp.

Pomfret : didn't expect it to be the entitire fish... head and all. Heavily spiced in the center. fish itself tasted very fresh.

Fish curry : yummy.could taste the fresh coconut. 

Prawn curry : standard onion tomato base. nothing special. 

Service was great. They were receptive to our feedback 
Wished they also had sol kadhi (which is typically served with fish dishes). Will go back to try other items on their menu.
author: Nilofer M.

description: Excellent food! Fair prices. Outstanding service!! Our waiters were extremely nice! Will definately be back again soon! Apparently the buffett is pretty legit too for lunch- real red roses and real candles on the tables as well - a very nice and rare touch these days :)
author: Sarah C.

description:
I went at lunch time on a Saturday afternoon, and was amazed first just at the price for their buffet--incredible value, lots of choices, plenty of vegetarian choices but chicken and fish too, and when we asked for naan--it arrived fresh and warm and  delicious. 

I went with an Indian friend who is a great cook and very critical. Her stamp of approval too, only added to my pleasure. 

They do take-out too and it's a lovely family run business !
author: katharine k.

description:
Worst food ever. 

This food should not be compared to Goan food in any way. 

The pomfret did not have salt in it.

The curries were over spicy and were in edible

--- Update on 05/05/2011

Got this email from Ricco Paul A.  who looks to be the owner i guess

"Looks like you are coming from Amazon who never ate in a plate.Keep it up jungee!"

To reply, i speak for a party of 10 who ate here, from which 2 are originally from goa, and hated the food. 

I'm guessing the cook of this place had changed considering the older reviews i read
author: Varun S.

description: I've yet to find better Indian in SF for the price point. Worth coming in from the North Bay for sure. I've had it all, traditional northern Indian plus their Goan dishes. Everything is on point.
author: Josh C.

description:
We found this restaurant just a block from our hotel on our 4th night and now wish we had known about it the first night in town as we would have eaten here at least 1 other time while visiting San Francisco. Yes that good. My boyf is Sinhalese and knows his Indian food and even he was excited about the food we received here.

First its a quiet little place with nice ambiance. Staff were all very attentive and courteous.

Keep in mind both my boyf and I love spicy so it was great to have a place that truly made things spicy  when asked to and not just what they think we can handle. I am very very fair but grew up eating jalapenos from the vine practically. But most people take one look at me and figure there is no way I can out spice my boyf but I do.

We started with the Goan Mussels cooked to perfection! Even tho spicy you could still taste the sweetness of the mussels. We also tried the Chicken Tikka Masala, Chicken 65, Goan Seafood Biryani, and garlic naan (there was something else in there too but I just cant remember it). All of it very good. But the biggest compliment comes from my boyf on the Biryani. He has yet to find in over a year in CA a Biryani that he would claim as good and this one he says is great.

If we are ever in San Fran you can be sure we will be back here again.
